characters: STICKS A GUN IN MICHAEL'S TEMPLE
STILL PHOTO OF OLE MISS CAMPUS
TEAM PHOTO OF THE 2005 SEATTLE SEAHAWKS 3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're watching footage of the 1985 Redskins/Giants Monday Night Football game. Lots of angles, faces, knuckles as t two teams line up, Redskins on offense, for the snap of t ball. As the play begins --

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE'S VOICE
dialogues.text: One Mississippi. Joe Theismann, the Redskins quarterback, takes the snap and hands off to his running back. JOE THEISMANN hands off to JOHN RIGGINS, who takes two st forward, then turns and tosses the ball back'to Theismann The footage PAUSES AND PLAYS like a coach breaking down f

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE'S VOICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Two Mississippi. It's a trick play, a flea flicker, and the running back tosses the ball back to the quarterback. HARRY CARSON, the Giants linebacker sees that Theismann h the ball back and races toward him. Theismann steps up an to the side and Carson flies past.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE'S VOICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Three Mississippi. Up to now the play's been defined by what the quarterback sees. It's about to be defined by what he doesn't. LAWRENCE TAYLOR carves a wide circle around the Redskins lineman trying to block him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blocker dives frantically. at Taylor's ankles, and mi Taylor leaps, arms raised, filling the sky behind Theisma The image FREEZES.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE'S VOICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Four Mississippi. Lawrence Taylor is the best defensive player in the NFL and has been from the time he stepped onto the field as a rookie. The frozen image of Taylor comes to life as he jackknifes Theismann's body. PLAYERS' FACES react to what they're seeing. Devastating. TAYLOR pops up from the pile and jumps around like a madm

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE'S VOICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He will also change the game of football as we know it. WE ARE WATCHING the MNF feed and hear the ANNOUNCER'S VOI

dialogues.speaker: FRANK GIFFORD, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Again, we'll look at it with the reverse angle one more time. And I suggest if your stomach is weak you just don't watch.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Joe Theissman never played another down of football.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE'S. VOICE
dialogues.text: Now, y'all would guess that more often than not the highest paid player on an NFL team is the quarterback. The camera finds MATT HASSELBECK, Seattle's quarterback.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE'S VOICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And you'd be right. What you probably don't know is that more often than not the second highest paid player is, thanks to Lawrence Taylor, a left tackle. The camera goes to WALTER JONES, Seattle's left tackle.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE'S VOICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Because, as every housewife knows, the first check you write is for the mortgage and the second is for the insurance. The left tackle's job is to protect the quarterback from what he can't see coming. To protect his blind side.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS 4
dialogues.text: "Famous" left tackles - Jonathan Ogden, Orlando Pace, And Gurode. Then we SEE SHOTS of their hands, feet, waists, etc., corresponding with ---

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE'S VOICE
dialogues.text: The ideal left tackle is big, but a lot of people are big. He is wide in the butt and massive in the thighs. He has long arms, giant hands and feet as quick as a hiccup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A street anchored by project housing and littered with br down cars and ne'er-do-wells. Lots of folks out, milling about, but our focus is on A TEENAGER in the distance, mo TOWARD US in SLO-MO while everyone else is at normal spee He's extremely large, six and a half feet, but he careful steps instead of strutting. His name is MICHAEL OHER.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE'S VOICE
dialogues.text: This is a rare and expensive combination the need for which can be traced to that Monday night game and Lawrence. Taylor. For on that day he not only altered Joe Theismann's life, but mine as well. As Michael continues toward us he begins to go OUT OF FOC

dialogues.speaker: INVESTIGATOR'S VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Mr. Oher, do you know why I'm here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Oher?...

dialogues.speaker: INVESTIGATOR'S.VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Do you know, do you understand why I'm here?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: To... investigate.

dialogues.speaker: INVESTIGATOR'S VOICE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Yes. To investigate. I'm here to investigate your odd... predicament.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like a government office. Not much more than a desk either side of which sit INVESTIGATOR GRANGER, an African American woman in a business suit, and Michael Oher. Mich slumps a bit, eyes the ground and rubs his hands on his k - a nervous trait of his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you find it odd? Your predicament?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iono [I don't know]... Investigator Granger sifts through her briefcase, pulls o files, documents - a good bit of evidence for whatever trouble Michael is in. She sits back, stares at Michael, as if trying to figure out. Michael can't meet her gaze. He looks out the window rubs his knees some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I... can I leave now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You can't.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERSCRIPT
dialogues.text: Michael sits in the back seat, behind STEVEN HAMILTON, 14 and his father, BIG TONY, who drives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a word is spoken as they drive through the streets of WEST MEMPHIS - poverty ridden. 8

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Taurus exits into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Taurus passes an endless supply of churches and strip joints, all of which Michael's eyes take in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've gone from slums to nice neighborhoods - fathers and sons play baseball, kids tend lemonade stands, sprinklers keep the grass emerald green. Michael's face tells us he's never seen anything like thi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Taurus enters the parking lot filled with nice cars. A12

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Tony strides down the almost empty hallway, spots a d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BERT COTTON, football coach, cleans off his desk, ready t leave for the day. Big Tony knocks at the door. BIG TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say you the coach. Cotton eyes Tony, offers a hand. COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bert Cotton. BIG TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony Hamilton, but everybody call me Big Tony. COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I do for you, Tony?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven and Michael eye the freshly painted buildings, the flowers, the new playground jungle gyms and outdoor hoops (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 6 13 CONTINUED: 13 STEVEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure is pretty, huh, Big Mike? Mike doesn't answer, just takes it all in. Steven sees an opens a container filled to the brim with balls - footbal basketballs, four square balls. STEVEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not even locked! MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White people are crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Tony and Cotton are mid-discussion --- BIG TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see I promised my mama Boo, on her deathbed, that I would get Steven outta public and into a church school. COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate that but I'm not involved with admissions. BIG TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured I'd come to you; seeing as you might need some players. COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What sport does he play? BIG TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything with a ball. Good, too. He has Cotton's attention for a moment, then it passes... COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Classes start in a week. It'd have to be for next semester. BIG TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you're thinking, Coach, but I got money. I'm a mechanic at Wilson's Auto t'other side of town. (ANOTHER TRY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if someone drops out or moves? Could they get in then? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 7 14 CONTINUED: 14 COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "They?" You only mentioned one son. BIG TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven, yessir, but I brought another boy along. COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another boy? BIG TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Big Mike. He stays on our couch sometimes. It's a bad deal. His mama's on the crack pipe and he ain't got nobody. He just wanted to come along with us today. COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would... Big Mike be an applicant as well? BIG TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure, why not. Cotton sighs, considers what to do. COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'd have to fill out applications and make an appointment for interviews. BIG TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was hopin' you might just interview 'em now. COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're here? Big Tony points out the.window to the playground where St and Michael are playing one on one basketball. BIG TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little ones Steven and the big ONE'S -- COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Mike. BIG TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. That's right. INTERCUT WITH:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a boy his size Michael can really move. He dribbles, fakes left, then falls away, making a long three pointer. Cotton's eyes get a little wider as he watches -- Michael dribbles the ball between his legs, behind his ba and jumps high, slamming the ball through the hoop. Big m aren't supposed to move like this. Cotton's lips are almost quivering -- COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother of God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Board of Admissions, eight or so men and women, are seated around a large conference table. By himself, at on end, sits Bert Cotton.  COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are there spots available or not? PAUL SANDSTROM, Principal, taps his fingers before...  SANDSTROM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Technically, yes, in both grades. But we have a greater responsibility than just filling classrooms. Steven Hamilton's  paperwork looks acceptable and I believe he would be capable of succeeding here but the other kid -- Sandstrom looks through papers for the name.  COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Mike. SANDSTROM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael Oher gives us no reason to believe, based on his record, that he would be successful here. COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How bad could it be? Another board member, MRS. SMITH, pores over Michael's fi which is a mess. She finds facts and lays them out --- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 9 16 CONTINUED: 16

dialogues.speaker: MRS. SMITH
dialogues.text: We're not sure exactly how old he is due to lack of records. He has a measured IQ of 80. That's 6th percentile. He's been enrolled in seven different institutions, including a gap of eighteen months around the age of ten when he apparently didn't attend school at all. He repeated first grade as well as second, there's no record of attendance in third, and in fourth grade -- COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So they moved him ahead without going to third grade. That says something.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. SMITH
dialogues.text: (IGNORING COTTON)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His attendance records are abysmal and his grade point average begins with a zero. Zero-point-six- Silence around the room. MRS. BOSWELL, a board member and science teacher, looks to the others.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BOSWELL
dialogues.text: Everyone passed him along - gave him D's so they could hand their problem off to the next school. COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brave kid. (off their confusion) For wanting to come here. For wanting a quality education. An education denied him by the poor quality of the schools he's attended. Most kids with his background wouldn't come within two hundred miles of this place.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. SMITH
dialogues.text: Coach Cotton, we understand your interest in the young man's athletic abilities. SANDSTROM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wouldn't be able to play until he got his grades up anyway. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Blind Side - Green Revision - 04/28/09 10 16 CONTINUED: 16 COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget sports! Look at the wall. He points to the crest on the wall. Beneath it: "NEIGHBOR ACADEMIC, CHRISTIAN". COTTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christian. We either take that seriously or we paint over it. You don't admit Michael Oher for sports, you admit him because it's the right thing to do. Their faces announce that he's made a point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First day of class. Students, mostly blonde-haired and bl eyed, wearing crisply laundered Abercrombie and Fitch, ca their backpacks through the school's arch and converse wi friends they haven't seen over the summer. Michael ENTERS FRAME. Fills it up in fact. He stares at t arch. Beneath the school name we read "WITH MEN THIS IS. POSSIBLE, WITH GOD ALL THINGS ARE POSSIBLE". Michael take deep breath and enters. He carries his "school bag" - a plastic grocery sack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as before, Michael moves at A DIFFERENT SPEED than t around him. Makes sense because he is different. Not only the color of his skin but his size, his clothes (short pa and T-shirt), his eyes taking in the pavement - all point the fact that he doesn't belong here. Small children from kindergarten and first grade give him wide, cautious berth. He's noticed and ogled by everyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Mrs. Boswell's biology class and she's writing on th board in front of a full classroom when Michael enters. H pauses and all eyes go to him. Mrs. Boswell does her best stifle a gasp as she first lays eyes on him. Then...

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BOSWELL
dialogues.text: Class, this is Mike Oher and he's new here so I expect you all to make him feel welcome. (with a warm smile) Mike, take any empty seat. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 11 19 CONTINUED: 19

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She urges him with a nod. Michael walks back and sits in corner, looking terrified. He barely fits in the seat. Mrs. Boswell hands out a stack of papers to each row. As students pass them back to others...

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BOSWELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is a quiz based on the information you learned last year in your science curriculum. (OVER GROANS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. It won't be graded. I just want to see how much of the information we need to hit again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just answer whatever you know. The student in front of Michael hands a sheet back to him eyes the size of his feet. The students start to work while Michael stares at the sh like it's written in Greek. Mrs. Boswell watches him for

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: few seconds before turning back to her work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bell RINGS and kids leave classrooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael sits alone while Mrs. Boswell collects the last o the papers. She walks over to Michael, looks down at his sheet. Nothing filled in, just his name scrawled at the t She tries to decide how to deal with this then opts for -

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BOSWELL
dialogues.text: It's okay. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I leave now? She nods and watches him stand and walk away. She glances down at the sheet, turns it over and sees... A DRAWING on the back - a boat on an ocean. On the boat i single, stick figure person. It's sweet but looks like a third grader drew it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael lies on a tattered sofa. The lights are out but Michael's eyes are open, staring at the light emanating f beneath a closed bedroom door. We hear voices...

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE, (O.S)
dialogues.text: Why he gotta always stay here?

dialogues.speaker: BIG TONY'S VOICE, (0.S)
dialogues.text: Ain't got nowhere else.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE, (O.S)
dialogues.text: And how's that your problem? You the Red Cross all of a sudden? Michael tries to shut his eyes. 23

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: School is out. Steven walks up to Michael... STEVEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Big Mike, um... my Pops' girlfriend... she don't really want you to stay with us no more. Big Tony's Taurus pulls into the lot. STEVEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can still give you rides if you want? MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, it's aright. Steven gets in the Taurus. Michael watches it drive away. 24

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A girl's volleyball game is in progress in the bg. As latecomers move en masse for entry into the gym, a small pretty lady on a cell phone moves.against the crowd; a sa on a mission. This is LEIGH ANNE Tuohy. And she's pissed. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on cell phone) I don't care if Patrick Ramsey did approve the chair. He's an NFL quarterback not Martha frickin' Stewart. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Blind Side - Green Revision - 04/28/09 13 24 CONTINUED: 24

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She arrives at the concession stand and waits impatiently

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There's a difference between Bunny Williams and Lazee-boy. (TO VENDOR)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three large popcorns and two large diets. (INTO CELL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When MTV Cribs comes to his house he'll be showing off his home theatre but all I'm gonna see is a brown Barca-lounger. I'm his designer, my name's on it. Deliver what I ordered!!! She hangs up angry, spots a friend nearby and her frown t into a smile that could light up a cave.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE
dialogues.text: Hi, sweetie! We're on the Kidspace committee together, aren't we?! It'll be a hoot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh Anne's husband SEAN TUOHY, handsome, confidant, and their 10-year-old son, SJ, sit, watching the game. During a time out, Sean eyes the crowd, sees something od In the upper corner of the gym sits Michael, by himself, rubbing his knees. Others around him, all white, have mov away. He's a very large island in the lily white gym. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S.J., you know that kid? SJ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kid? SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black kid. Up in the corner. SI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be goes to high school here. His name is Big something... Big Mike. Sean eyes Michael suspiciously. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 14 25 CONTINUED: 25 SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He look like a volleyball fan to you? Leigh Anne, loaded up with refreshments, makes her way up stands to her family. She has a nod, a smile, a bon mot, everyone she passes. As she sits... LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd I miss? SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins got a dig. SI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's girl's volleyball, Mom. You didn't miss anything. Leigh Anne gives him a look then stands and shouts -- LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins! Move your feet! ON THE COURT - COLLINS TUOHY, a beautiful 16-year-old, si and gives her mother a look - "Don't embarrass me!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scoreboard tells us that the game is over. Fans file out. The Tuohy family waits in a group as the volleyball team exits the court. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins, we'll wait outside. And don't double condition in the shower - you still have homework! COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going over to Cannon's house to study. SI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I go.to the Johnson's for dinner? They invited me. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's so awful about our house? Sean smiles, shakes his head as SJ and Collins leave. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 15 26 CONTINUED: 26

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean's eyes go to the upper stands where he sees Michael, alone, walking slowly, then bending down, picking somethi up, taking a few more steps and repeating the process. Picking up left-over bags of popcorn. Sean considers this for a second before leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teachers drink stale coffee and chew on donuts.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST TEACHER, (BOB)
dialogues.text: Well, the big guy's been here a month and he ain't cutting it in my class.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND TEACHER, (APRIL)
dialogues.text: Why would Admissions do this? It's not fair to us or the boy.

dialogues.speaker: THIRD TEACHER, (GLENDA)
dialogues.text: Just setting him up to fail. BOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think he has any idea what I'm teaching. GLENDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how would you know if he did? He won't even talk. Mrs. Boswell can't contain herself.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BOSWELL
dialogues.text: He writes. APRIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name. Barely. Mrs. Boswell goes to'her purse, pulls out a crumpled page

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BOSWELL
dialogues.text: He threw this in the trash can. (reads from the page) "I look and I see white everywhere: white walls, white floors, and a lot of white people. The teachers do not know I have no idea of anything they are talking about. I do not want to listen to anyone, especially the teachers. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 16 27 CONTINUED: 27

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BOSWELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They are giving homework and expecting me to do the problems on my own. I have never done homework in my life. I go to the bathroom, look in the mirror and say, "This is not Michael Oher." (a pause for effect) He entitled it "White Walls." The room is dead quiet. BOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the spelling? Mrs. Boswell stuffs the page back in her purse and leaves

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean and Coach Cotton sip coffee while all around them students eat their lunches. They are looking at Michael, sits by himself without a tray in front of him. COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he makes his grades he'll be eligible in the spring. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he makes his grades. COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But boy-hidey, just look at him. Cotton is admiring Michael's size but Sean sees something else. He stands, walks over to Michael, who barely looks SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you eat for lunch today? MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here in the cafeteria. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't ask where you ate, I asked what you ate. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few things. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you need some money? For lunch? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 17 28 CONTINUED: 28 MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need any. Sean walks back over to Coach Cotton. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buy him a semester lunch pass and put it on my bill. (off Cotton's look) He's hungry. COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could tell that by looking at him? SEAN -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't grow up all that different from him. At public school they

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: give you free lunch, Bert. And when food is finite, you'd be surprised how much time you can spend thinking about it..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Boswell distributes a test to the class.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BOSWELL
dialogues.text: You'll have one hour. If you finish early put it on my desk and sit quietly. She looks at the class as they begin to work, then sees Michael just staring at his test. She sighs, makes a decision, rises and walks over.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BOSWELL
dialogues.text: Mike, come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Filled with supplies and a small desk. Mrs. Boswell point and he sits.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BOSWELL
dialogues.text: You can take the test back here away from everybody else. I'll sit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in there so if there's anything you don't understand you can ask. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 18 30 CONTINUED: 30

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael's eyes go to the page in front of him. He rubs hi hands on his knees and stares. Mrs. Boswell waits a beat then scoots her chair over next to him.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BOSWELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mike, how about I ask the questions and you tell me the answers or as much as you know. She looks at his hands - huge next to hers - then reads:

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BOSWELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Protozoans are classified based on: a) how they get their food, b) how they reproduce, c) how they move, or d) both a and c. Michael just stares. After a long moment MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iono...

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BOSWELL
dialogues.text: Just try. Ask questions if you don't understand. But still Michael stares at the page. The look on her fac says she's about to give up when He lifts his eyes to her and points to -- -- the question on the test - specifically to the word "classified".

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BOSWELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: "Classified". It means how things are grouped together. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like our "class"?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BOSWELL
dialogues.text: Exactly. This science course is classified based on what grade y'all are in. Eleventh. Michael nods understanding.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BOSWELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, Mike, you ready to answer the question? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 19 30 CONTINUED: 30

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same group of teachers. Mrs. Boswell bursts through the door, holding the test.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BOSWELL
dialogues.text: He knows it! BOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who knows it and what does he know?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BOSWELL
dialogues.text: The material. Michael Oher. I gave him this test verbally. She holds up the test -- marked with a large red "C". APRIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On how big a curve?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BOSWELL
dialogues.text: He's been listening the whole time. It's amazing what he's absorbed. And, trust me, he's listening to you, too. Okay, so his reading level is low and he has no idea how to learn in a classroom, but... (makes her point) I'm not saying he's going to pass but Big Mike is not stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: School is out and Michael walks among the kids of all sha and sizes. Two little Kindergarten girls'try and swing themselves. Michael stops nearby, watching them. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're stuck, not sure if they should talk to this "stranger". They jump off the swings and run away. SI (OS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smile at 'em. Michael turns to see Si nearby, watching him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Blind Side - Green Revision - 04/28/09 20 32 CONTINUED: 32 SJ (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It lets them know you're their friend. Did you know that even little kids born blind smile? They've never seen anyone do it before but they smile anyway. So it's universal. That's why it works. Not that you should fake it or anything... You're Big Mike, right? Sean holds. out a fist for Mike to "knock" and the two wa toward the school entrance. SJ (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Sean, but everyone calls me Si -- that's for Sean Junior because my father's name is Sean. Sean Tuohy. He was a basketball star at Ole Miss, point guard, and now he owns like a million Taco Bells. Leigh Anne's car pulls up to the pick up/drop off and Si starts toward it. SJ (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manana'. Michael smiles at the kid, who smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh Anne notices Michael as she drives past him. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that SJ? SI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Mike. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your feet off my dash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael watches Leigh Anne's car disappear.

dialogues.speaker: SANDSTROM, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Big Mike?... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 21 34 CONTINUED: 34

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael turns to see Paul Sandstrom, the principal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael and Sandstrom sit on a bench. SANDSTROM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike, I just got a call from someone at the police department. (off Michael's look) Do you remember the story in the papers awhile back about the man who fell off an overpass? (Michael shakes his head) No one knew who he was and they're not sure if he jumped, or if... at any rate he passed away. Sandstrom struggles with how to say the words.  SANDSTROM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike, the man... was your father. Michael takes this in. without showing emotion. SANDSTROM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've been looking for someone to notify and came across your name on our registry. I'm really sorry, son. (NO RESPONSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you close? (Michael shakes his head) When did you last see him? MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iono. SANDSTROM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try and find out where he's buried. Maybe we could go visit? Michael nods, then rises and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael sits at a bus stop with his bag, rises as a bus s in front of him. 37 OMITTED 37

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Blind Side -- Yellow Draft - 04/15/09 22

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty seedy. Michael walks to a sink in the back, opens plastic sack, pulls out an extra T-shirt and starts to wa it. A WOMAN, the only other patron, reads a magazine. When he turns to look at her, she becomes quite nervous. She sets down the magazine and walks outside. It seems Michael was expecting this because as soon as sh leaves he takes his wet T-shirt, wrings it-out, walks to dryer and tosses the shirt inside to dry with her things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael sits in the corner, his head resting against the window, trying to sleep.  DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A banner over the arch reads: THANKSGIVING PAGEANT TONIGH Kids in costume - Pilgrims, Indians, turkeys - race out t door to greet their proud parents. Si, in an ornate headdress looks for and spots Sean and Leigh Anne waving. They walk away together toward the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they exit the parking lot-- LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn on the heat! SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know where it is. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fifteen degrees, you've had this car a month and you don't know how to turn on the heat?! (as she turns it on) What would you do without.me? SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lots of things you'll never know about. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 23 43 CONTINUED: 43

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They trade a look and a smile. Sean puts a.hand on her la SI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get a room. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Si, don't let this go to your head but I thought you were very convincing in the role of... uh... SI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indian Number Three. I tried out for the Chief but they gave it to Andy Sung. I can't be sure but I think there was some multi-cultural bias thing working. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or maybe they just thought he'd make a better Chief. SI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, he's like Chinese. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're Irish. If you weren't the Chief how come you got the headdress? Si hesitates a bit before -- SI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, I'm gonna need a few more of those free Quesadilla tickets. LEIGH ANNE (LAUGHS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And where does the acorn fall? SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't laugh too hard. The Quesadilla saved our ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean's car stops at a red light and Michael crosses in fr of them, wearing just his shorts and short sleeved shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh Anne notices Michael -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: B44 CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is he wearing? It's below freezing. What's his name again?

dialogues.speaker: SEAN AND SJ
dialogues.text: Big Mike. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's he going? She gives Sean a look. Sean rolls down his window. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Big Mike! Michael stops in the crosswalk, looks to the car. SEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you headin'? MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gym.._. Sean nods, rolls his window back up and drives as the lig turns green. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gym? It's nine o'clock. No answer to this. They drive another half block,before -

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Turn around. Sean sighs, knowing better than to argue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BMW pulls to a stop alongside Michael. Leigh Anne get out, walks up to Michael. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Mike, my name is Leigh Anne Tuohy. My kids go to Wingate. You said you're going to the gym? Michael slowly nods.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The school gym's closed. Michael takes this in but doesn't respond. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 25 44 CONTINUED: 44

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why were you going to the gym? (again no answer) Big Mike?! Why were you going to the gym? MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because... it's warm. This hits her all at once. She bites her lip. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have anywhere to stay tonight? Michael eyes the ground, then nods.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't you dare lie to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean and SJ watch the discussion without hearing any of i Leigh Anne looks to Sean, then back to Michael. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen that look many times. She's about to get her way. Leigh Anne makes her way back to the car, with Michael in tow. She opens the back door and he gets in next to SJ in his headdress. Leigh Anne climbs into the front seat, clo the door. Sean is looking at her. SEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where we going? LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car enters the driveway of a beautiful home and stops

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael's eyes are frozen at the sight. To him it looks l a mansion. Hell, it IS a mansion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Blind Side - Green Revision - 04/28/09 26

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins, in her pjs, talks on the phone while watching TV listening to the stereo. She wears a tangerine cleansing masque on her face. When the family enters behind her -- COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd the dork do in the play? She turns to see... Sean, Leigh Anne, SJ in headdress and Big Mike. COLLINS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh Anne lays out pillows, sheets, blankets on the couc LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd give you the guest bedroom but it's full of sample boxes. And the sectional in the family room slides apart when you sleep on it. At least that's what Sean says. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Tuohy sleeps on the couch?  LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only when he's bad. There's a powder room right there and we're upstairs if you need us. The two share a look, then...

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sleep tight, honey. She leaves. Michael is dumbfounded, stares at everything the room, then sits on the couch. SJ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Psst... SJ is in the doorway to the kitchen. SJ (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you can't sleep, my room is the first one at the top of the back stairs. I got X-Box, Madden, everything. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Blind Side - Green Revision - 04/28/09 26A 49 CONTINUED: 49

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael nods then smiles. SJ smiles back, gives a thumbs and disappears. Michael's eyes go to a coffee table book (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 27 49 CONTINUED: 49

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NORMAN ROCKWELL. On the cover is "FREEDOM FROM WANT" - picturing a family sitting around a dinner table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They lie in bed, awake. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was this a bad idea? SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't lie there and pretend you're not thinking the same thing as me. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, tell me what you're thinking so I can know what's supposed to be on my mind. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How well do you know Big Mike? SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In case you haven't noticed he doesn't have much to say. What's the big deal? It's just one night. (after a beat) It is just one night, right?.. Leigh Anne?... LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think he'll steal anything? SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we'll know in. the morning. He rolls over to go to sleep. Leigh Anne just sits, stare

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh Anne finishes teasing her hair. Sean rides an exerc bike. Before she leaves the room... LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you hear a scream call the insurance adjustor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh Anne enters Collins' bedroom. Very "teenage girl" b a mess - clothes everywhere. Leigh Anne opens the curtain throwing light into the room. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up and at 'em. Collins groans. Leigh Anne picks up a few pieces of cloth on her way out and groans at the mess. We stay with her a she re-enters the hallway, walks and opens the door to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as messy but not all clothes. Leigh Anne almost trip on a series of wires connecting games to a large screen T LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean Junior! She opens the shades.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Clean this place up before you come downstairs. You hear me? Si crawls out of bed and Leigh Anne exits the room and st down the stairs, almost afraid of what she'll find.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh Anne stops, stares -- The couch is totally back to normal and the sheets, blank and pillows are neatly stacked in almost military precisi No sign of Michael. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike? Big Mike?! Nothing. She hears a DOG BARKING in the neighborhood and moves to the window to look out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, plastic sack in hand, walks away. Leigh Anne exi the front door, spots Michael and tries to catch up. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Mike! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Blind Side - Yellow Draft -- 04/15/09 29 55 CONTINUED: 55

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops, turns. Leigh Anne walks over.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where are you going? MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iono. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you spending Thanksgiving with your family? Michael shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh. Anne carves turkey onto a tray and takes it into..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh Anne sets the turkey on a serving table alongside t rest of the Tuohy Thanksgiving feast. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come and get it! Sean sits at the TV,"watching an Ole Miss football game, while SJ plays.video games on another. Collins chats on h cell. Michael sits off to the side, taking it all in. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SJ, Ole Miss is about to score! SI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which means they're about to fumble. They all shuffle over, grab plates, start piling on food. Sean loads his plate and heads back to the couch. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks great, hon. Collins plate is pretty delicately apportioned. COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see a lot of starch. SJ jams turkey into a roll and lathers on cranberry sauce creating an easy to eat sandwich. He walks away. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 30 57 CONTINUED: 57

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael stares - he's never seen so much food. Leigh Anne hands him a plate. He gingerly puts a slice of.turkey on LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As much as you want. (WALKS AWAY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, the potato salad! With no one watching him, Michael shoves two rolls into h pants pocket and finishes filling his plate. Leigh Anne reenters to see Michael sitting at the dining table, alone, not touching his plate. Her eyes go to the rest of her family, shoving down food playing games. She makes a decision, grabs the remote and turns off the TVs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire family sits at the table. Rockwell would be pr SI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are we eating in here? Leigh Anne holds out her hands. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall we say grace? The Tuohy family plus Michael hold hands. Collins stares at her tiny hand intertwined with Michael' As Leigh Anne prays Michael tries to emulate behavior wit closing his eyes, taking it all in...

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Heavenly Father. We thank you for all your many blessings on this family. We thank you for bringing us a new friend. And we ask that you look after. us in this holiday season and never let us forget just how very fortunate we are. Amen. A chorus of Amens and they all dig in. Michael is unsure first how to correctly use the silverware. He picks up th fork and Leigh Anne nods, "that's right". She eyes Michae stained shirt. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 31 58 CONTINUED: 58

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Big Mike, do you like to shop? (off his look) Because tomorrow I think I'm gonna have to show you how it's done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh Anne drives and Michael sits shotgun. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I qot clothes. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You "have" clothes.. And an extra T- shirt in a plastic bag does not a wardrobe make. He looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, fine, let's go get 'em. Just tell me where I'm going. No answer. Frustrated, she pulls the car over to the curb and puts it in park.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tell me everything I need to know about you. He still stares out the window.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who takes care of you? (NO ANSWER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mother? Do you have a mother? (NO RESPONSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A grandmother maybe? Nothing. Leigh Anne turns off the car.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look, Big Mike, we can do this the easy way - or we can do it the hard way. Take your pick. He eyes the floor.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fine. Tell me one thing I should know about you. One thing! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 32 59 CONTINUED: 59

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a beat... MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like to be called Big Mike. She wasn't expecting this, nods her head. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Mike or Michael? (off his shrug) Tell you what, from now on, to me, 'you're Michael. So,... Michael, where we headed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An expansive beehive of rotting housing. It's the place w saw when we first laid eyes on Michael and nothing's chan Leigh Anne's car stops at one of the complexes. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where your mother lives? He nods and she opens her door.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, let's go. He forcefully reaches across her and closes the door, catching her off guard. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get out! LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's going to help you with your clothes? MICHAEL (POINTED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get out of the car. Michael gets out on his side and takes care to push the l before he closes the door. She watches as he walks toward the structure, then notice several of the local ne'er-do-wells eyeing her. she locks the doors again, just for luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael walks slowly past a few gang-bangers on the steps The obvious leader, ALTON, eyes him. ALTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Mike! Where you been?! Michael ignores, keeps walking. ALTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And who's that fine piece o' thing driving you around? One of Alton's minions, DAVID, sits nearby. Michael sees him, nods. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, David. David, a little embarrassed to be with Alton, nods back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael arrives at an apartment and stops, taken aback. O the door is an EVICTION NOTICE and padlock. He reads from the eviction for several seconds. An Addict down the way fires up and slumps into bliss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Leigh Anne's car in the bg., Michael, hidden from vi slumps against a wall, looking lost - the first real emot we've seen from-him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She watches as Michael approaches the building with nothi in his hands, and makes his way back to the car. She unlo it and he crawls inside. After a pregnant moment... MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wadn't home. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can come back. Michael takes this in, looks out the window. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 34 63 CONTINUED: 63 MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She prolly moved to a nicer place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong side of the tracks. Michael and Leigh Anne cross th street toward the shop. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've lived in Memphis my whole life and never been anywhere near here. You're going to take care of me, right? MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got your back. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good to know. Thank you. As they start to walk, Leigh Anne reaches up and takes Michael's arm. He holds it out for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An AFRICAN AMERICAN SALESMAN directs Leigh Anne and Micha SALESMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything I got to fit him will be -right here. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it? If this is all you got why's it say "Big and Tall" on the sign? SALESMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big and Tall. You need "Bigger and Taller". He walks away. She starts to pore through the small rack. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything you like? (HE SHRUGS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one thing I know about shopping is that if you don't absolutely love it in the store, you won't wear it. The store is where you like it best. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 35 65 CONTINUED: 65

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And before you choose something think about yourself wearing it and ask yourself: Is this me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finds one shirt, holds it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes his head, "no".

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (ANOTHER SHIRT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't atrocious. SHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes his head again. After a beat he points. almost laughs.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This one? This is the one you like? He nods, completely sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop off area. Leigh Anne's car pulls up and SJ, Collins Michael get out. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a great day. Learn something! They say a few good-byes, get out and walk toward the arc Only then do we see what Michael is wearing: a GARGANTUAN ORANGE AND MAROON STRIPED RUGBY SHIRT. Leigh Anne shakes her head, watching him walk away. A car behind her HONKS. She checks the rear view mirror --

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't get your panties in a wad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies who lunch. The right sort doing their thing. Leigh Anne sits at a table with three friends, BETH, ELAINE and SHERRY. They sip on lemon water and nibble at salads. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The best part about Paris was the food. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Blind Side - Yellow Draft -- 04/15/09 36 67 CONTINUED: 67 BETH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They use sauce like we use gravy. I had to join a gym the day'we got back. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any of y'all spent much time on the other side of town? ELAINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the freeway. SHERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where exactly are you talking about? LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alabama Street... Hurt Village. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurt Village -- that sounds like a threat. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not far off. SHERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would "hurt" me to go there. ELAINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would certainly hurt your reputation to go there. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tongue in cheek) I'm actually from there but didn't mind hard work and look where I am now. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eating an eighteen dollar salad. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's a little soggy to be honest. SHERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Such a shame. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: her salad) Yes it is. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 37 67 CONTINUED: 67 SHERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Civil rights was responsible for some good things but those programs - building ugly, low cost housing. I mean how could you be creative if you lived there? It's stifling. ELAINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know that black men were employed at a higher rate before those programs? It's a fact. BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not "black", Elaine. The term du jour is African-American. ELAINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what if they're from Jamaica, or like Bermuda. SHERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then they're BerMUDian-Americans. They all cringe and laugh. ELAINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, why are you asking about the projects, Leigh.Anne? Another one of your charities? BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A project for the projects. That's catchy. Money would raise itself. (off their laughs) Don't laugh. Count me in, Leigh Anne. And they laugh harder. Leigh Anne smiles, biting her lip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SJ and Michael sit at the island doing their homework. SI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can't be that hard. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah?... Si looks at the Michael's notebook. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 38 68 CONTINUED: 68 SI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are different parts of a sentence and you just have to draw lines showing what they do. Sean stops by the refrigerator for a cold drink while he talks on his cell... SEAN (INTO CELL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're gonna get rid of those stores in Florida... I'll look it over now but I need the sales figures by tomorrow morning. SJ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, you remember how to diagram sentences? SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah. Sean starts to leave, then stops at the door, turns aroun sighs and walks over. He leans in over Michael. SEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see... MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to help. (off Sean's. look) I mean if you're busy or somethin'. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. (points to page) Think of a sentence like a football team. This is a noun here, see? That's like the team name or what they're known for - whether they're a running team or a passing team. And this is the verb. That's what makes 'em go - like a star player -- maybe a quarterback, maybe a running back. And this is an adjective - everybody oohs and ahs over adjectives but they're not as important as verbs. SI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're like wide receivers. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 39 68 CONTINUED: 68 SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or kickers. Michael just stares at them. SEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no idea what we're talking about, do you? MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not exactly. They all laugh. NEARBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh Anne watches, fixated on the image of the three. Se has an arm on Michael's shoulder. She smiles, almost sadl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh Anne hands over clean sheets and pillows to Michael who starts to make the bed. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to stay here, Michael? He keeps working.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Because if you want to... stay... for awhile... longer... I'll try and find some time to figure out a bedroom for you. He stops, turns to her. She walks over, examines the structure of the couch. It sags a bit.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I mean, look at this, you've practically ruined a.ten thousand dollar couch. She moves closer to him. Her face softens.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you want to stay here, Michael? MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to go anyplace else. She's a bit befuddled by the response. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 40 69 CONTINUED: 69 LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well,... alright then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh Anne sits in a chair reading through Michael's file LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see here on the admission that we're Michael's contact for medical emergencies? Mrs. Smith (from the admissions meeting) sits with her.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. SMITH
dialogues.text: Sean wrote that in last week. We needed a contact number and the ones listed weren't in service. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love that man. Leigh Anne pulls out another sheet, hands it over...

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. SMITH
dialogues.text: The state makes schools measure for career aptitude in eighth grade. It came with his'file. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They try to figure out what a kid's going to be in the eighth grade? What does. it say about Michael? Mrs. Smith nods and reads over Michael's results.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. SMITH
dialogues.text: Doesn't look promising. Spatial relations - third percentile.. Ability to learn - fifth percentile. (sees another number) It's funny though. He tested in the 98th percentile in one category. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 41 70 CONTINUED: 70

dialogues.speaker: MRS. SMITH
dialogues.text: "Protective instincts." Leigh Anne smiles and hands the file back.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. SMITH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's just so sad. Leigh Anne considers this, then... LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it is sad. So sad. But he either doesn't know it or doesn't think so and it's my job, and your job, to make sure he doesn't find out. (off Mrs. Smith's look) Michael Oher doesn't feel sorry for himself and I'll be damned if he starts to because of the way we treat him. (again off her look) "Darned."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now turned into Michael's room, with an armoire, a chest drawers, night stands, the whole nine yards. The bed is a massive futon in an ornate stand. Leigh Anne and Michael stand in the doorway. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to put half my samples in storage but well, anyway, back there's a desk. (points as she talks) Chest o'drawers. Night stand. Lamps. Alarm clock. Bed. Sean says a lot of pro athletes use futons if they can't find a big enough bed. Michael doesn't dare touch anything, just stares in awe.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, try it out. See if it feels okay. He gingerly moves to the bed; touches it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 42 71 CONTINUED: 71 MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's mine? LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (off his look) What? MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never had one before. LEIGH ANNE (CONFUSED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A room to yourself? MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bed. We can see this unsettles her. She turns away a bit, tryi to contain herself. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you got one now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaves the room, walks down the hall and enters --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She.closes the door behind her, sits on the bed and start tear up. She fights it unsuccessfully.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE DOOR
dialogues.text: Michael stands, unsure what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Boswell gives Michael - in a RED AND BLUE RUGBY SHIR an oral test...

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BOSWELL
dialogues.text: Define Osmosis, Michael. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I know that. It's when water...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Boswell grades the paper and puts C+ at the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, this time wearing a GREEN AND GOLD RUGBY SHIRT, orally tested by GLENDA...  GLENDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name the combatants in the battle of Waterloo. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that. The little guy, Napoleon was on one side and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glenda marks down a C-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, in another rugby shirt, this one BLACK AND YELLO carries a tray and sits with SJ, who starts laughing. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? SJ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough with the rugby shirts. You look like a giant bumble bee. Collins walks by with friends and glances but ignores the GIRL STUDENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's the big guy hanging around with your little brother? COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just another one of Mom's projects. GIRL STUDENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That must get incredibly old. Collins' look says, "yes it does." 80 OMITTED 80

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob grades Michael's paper. He writes "D".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole family, including Michael, rides in the car. SJ points out fast food restaurants along the way -- SI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That Taco Bell. The KFC catty corner. The Long John Silvers on the next block. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You own all of 'ern? SJ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. We've got hundreds. COLLINS' (CORRECTING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hundred and fifteen. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that why Mr. Tuohy don't have to go to work? SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hey now. I'm working even when I'm not working. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And y'all eat at those places for free? SI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All you want. It's awesome. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do y'all do with the leftover food? At the restaurant?, SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we have to throw some of it away. What's already been cooked. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's too bad. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'd rather sell it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 45 82 CONTINUED: 82 SI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seems like you could give it away or something? You should check into that, Daddy. Leigh Anne and Sean share a look and a smile. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, I will. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why ain't we eatin' at one of yours tonight? SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .Because tonight is a special occasion. SJ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I talked to Coach Cotton today. Michael's grades improved enough that he can do spring'training for football in March. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that great? SI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, man, you are gonna crush some people! Michael almost smiles, a little unsure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean's car pulls up to the valet. As the family gets out Leigh Anne notices a bookstore next door and starts for i LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a design book I need to get. Sean, go check on our reservation. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll seat us when we walk in the door. You can get the book after dinner. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 46 83 CONTINUED: 83 LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (already walking away) They might be closed by then. COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need some new magazines. SJ shrugs and joins the girls, as does Michael. Sean watc as his family deserts him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh Anne finds the book she's looking for and walks thr the stacks looking for her kids, plus Michael. She finds them all together in the children's section, laughing. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, your dad's already PO'ed. Collins holds up a book. Sendak's WHERE THE WILD THINGS A COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember this one, Mom? You read it to us like a thousand times. She softens, walks over, takes the book. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "And he gnashed his terrible teeth and roared his terrible roar.- SI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always liked this one. He holds up THE STORY OF FERDINAND. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, me too. Leigh Anne sees Michael left out, but interested.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Michael, your Mama ever read either one of those to you? He just stares at her, the answer obvious.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No one ever...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tuohy family exits and waits for the valet. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that was a good steak. COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Daddy. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome. As the car pulls up everyone walks toward it except Micha who notices something else -- AT THE SIDE DOOR: A BUSBOY steps outside for a smoke. Michael absently walks over.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Michael?... Leigh Anne touches Sean's arm, silencing him. They watch Michael greets the busboy. They stand a few feet apart talking. They nod at each other and after a few seconds - They hug. Leigh Ann is amazed. She's never seen affection in Michae

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they drive home. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was that boy you were talking to, Michael? At the restaurant. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He works there? MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 48 86 86 CONTINUED: LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how do you know Marcus? MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's my brother. Complete silence in the car. Leigh Anne finally breaks it LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'd like to meet him someday. Would that be okay with you? MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know where he stays. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When's the last time you saw him, Michael? MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was little mebbe. 87

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins sits on the floor in the hallway near a door, smi sadly and secretly listening to ---

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE'S VOICE
dialogues.text: "Once upon a time in Spain, there was a little bull --" A88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A strange sight. Leigh Anne, SJ and Michael all sit on Michael's huge futon as Leigh Anne reads THE STORY OF FERDINAND. No one enjoys this more than Leigh Anne... LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "...and his name was Ferdinand. All the other little bulls he lived with would run and jump and butt their heads together, but not Ferdinand. He liked to sit just quietly and smell the flowers"... 88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh Anne and Sean sit in bed. Sean puts his book on the night stand and leans over to give Leigh Anne a kiss. He notices her smile... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Blind side - Yellow Draft -- 04/15/09 49 88 CONTINUED: 88 SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you smiling? LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I'm just happy. Really happy. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does. this happiness have anything to do with Michael? LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It has everything to do with Michael. Sean smiles, kisses her, turns off the light. She snuggle next to him and kisses the back of his neck. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... He gets the message, rolls over and kisses her on the lip SEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy's good. As their amorous activities continue... LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we should start a charity. For kids like him. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his mind elsewhere) Sure, okay. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe fund a program at Wingate. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely... LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you even listening to me? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 50 88 CONTINUED: 88 SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I try to concentrate on one thing at a time. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew I was a multi-tasker when you married me. She kisses him and they roll over, laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tuohy family, dressed nice, poses in front of a blue' red artificial Christmas tree adorned ENTIRELY WITH OLE M ORNAMENTS. They are posing for a photograph. PHOTOGRAPHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, big smiles everyone! FLASH! Leigh Anne smiles but notices --- Michael sitting on the couch by himself. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael! Come over here and get in the next one. Sean gives her a look like she's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We don't have a single picture with him. (off Sean's sigh) Oh, come on. It's not like I'm gonna put it on the Christmas card. Michael moves in behind the family, dwarfing them. PHOTOGRAPHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, really big smiles. One, two, three... say Rebels! FLASH TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New Year's Day. Sean, Si and Michael watch football. Collins sits on the couch reading. Leigh Anne comes in th front door with groceries. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 51 90 CONTINUED: 90 LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's winning? SI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tennessee. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad. Who are they playing? SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you root against Tennessee no matter who they're playing? LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. With gusto. SI (TO MICHAEL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can't stand Tennessee. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collie-bell, I thought you were going to your boyfriend's? COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just gonna hang around here today. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like that. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coupla messages on the machine. She pushes PLAY on the message machine. MESSAGE MACHINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Leigh Anne, it's Patrick Ramsey. INTERCUT WITH:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PATRICK RAMSEY, on his cell phone, near his locker... PATRICK RAMSEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sent me these measurements for clothes and I posted 'em in the locker room for donations but there's a problem. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Blind Side - Yellow Draft -- 04/15/09 52

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK RAMSEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I mean, are you sure the sizes are right, because there's nobody on our team who's that big? Gimme a call. BACK TO SCENE:.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh Anne chuckles as the next message begins -- MESSAGE MACHINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Sean, hey Leigh Anne, it's cousin Bobby. Happy New Years! INTERCUT WITH:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby sits in his recliner, talks on phone... COUSIN BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I've had about five cold ones so'I'm just gonna go ahead and ask... Who's the colored boy in y'all's,Christmas Card?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh Anne and Sean look at each other and laugh.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Leigh Anne, you looked teeny-tiny next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh Anne sits at a table with her lunch buddies. They'r finishing up and are all laughing hard except Leigh Anne. ELAINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was like you were Jessica Lange and he was King Kong. SHERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I taped your card to, the fridge. The next morning Frank almost gagged on his orange juice. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 53 91 CONTINUED: 91 BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does Michael get the family discount at Taco Bell? Because if he does Sean's gonna lose a few stores. More laughter. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, he's a great kid. ELAINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say just make it official and adopt him. Big laughs at the "crazy" idea. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be eighteen in a few months. (off their confusion) So, I mean it wouldn't make much sense to legally adopt him, right? They realize she's thought about it and stop laughing. Af an awkward beat of silence... SHERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this some kind of white guilt thing, Leigh Anne? I mean charity's the Lord's work but... ELAINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What will your daddy say? LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before or after he turns over in his grave? Daddy's gone five years now, Elaine, and to make matters worse you were at the funeral. You wore Chanel with that awful black hat. Before Elaine can attack --

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look, here's the deal. I don't need any of y'all to approve of my choices. But I do ask you to respect them. You have no idea what this boy's been through. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And if this is going to be a running diatribe I can find an overpriced salad a lot closer to home. SHERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry, Leigh Anne. We didn't intend to -- ELAINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we didn't, really -- BETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, what you're doing is so great. To open your home to him. You're changing his life. Leigh Anne smiles to herself, realizing... LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He's changing mine. ELAINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's awesome for you, but... what about Collins? LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Collins? ELAINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you worried, even just a little? (off Leigh Anne) I mean he is a boy, a large, black boy, sleeping under the same roof. Leigh Anne stares at them, shakes her head then grabs the CHECK --- LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got this. (rises; to the group) Shame on you. And strides away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins is reading in bed. Leigh Anne knocks, enters and sits on the edge of the bed. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 55 92 92 CONTINUED: LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be honest with me now, okay? Collins nods, having no idea what her mother is about to

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is Michael being here weird for you? COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're stupid kids, who cares what they say. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kids? COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At school. They're juvenile. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what do the juvenile kids say? COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's really not worth repeating. And don't worry about SJ - he loves the attention. He introduces Michael as his big brother. LEIGH ANNE
