dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you? COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine. (off Leigh Anne's look) I mean, you can't just throw him out on the street. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can make other arrangements. (off Collins' hesitance) Just let me know. Okay?... Leigh Anne kisses Collins goodnight. 93

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael walks up to the two little Kindergarten girls fro before, sitting in the swings. He smiles. They smile back

dialogues.speaker: FIRST LITTLE GIRL
dialogues.text: Hi Mike. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 56 93 CONTINUED: 93 MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Need a push? They giggle and Michael pushes them, one arm each until they're flying high and squealing. NEARBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins is sitting with her friends, laughing and whisper She notices Michael enter and walk to a table with a book He sits alone while every other table is full. Collins sighs, makes up her mind and stands with her book FRIEND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going? Collins walks away toward Michael. FRIEND (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins? They are aghast when they see Collins set down her books across from Michael and sit.

dialogues.speaker: AT MICHAEL'S TABLE
dialogues.text: Michael is confused. She looks at him and shakes her head COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quit looking at me like that. I mean, we study together at home. Eyes in the library are on the pair as they start to read

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several players, in full gear, drag equipment out onto th field under the watchful eye of Bert Cotton. Sean Tuohy s in the nearby stands. Michael carries four blocking dummies to the center of th field and tosses them like they're pillows. Cotton smiles COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how much those things weigh? This kid's gonna make us all famous. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 57 95 95 CONTINUED: SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, Bert. It's only the spring and he hasn't even been through his first practice. (LATER) 96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael is lined up at defensive tackle. The offense brea the huddle and Michael just stands there. He notices the other defensive linemen get in a stance and kind of squat bit. When the ball is snapped he just holds his hands out keeping the blocker from getting close to his body. The running back races right past him and into the second THE WHISTLE BLOWS and Cotton races up to Michael. COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Mike, you fought off the block but you've got to shuck him and make the tackle. You got it? NEXT PLAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael gets down in a his stance and when the ball is snapped he gets under the blocker and lifts him up like W The quarterback goes back to pass and sees Michael lumber toward him with the lineman on his shoulders. The Quarterback's eyes go wide and he races out of the po and throws and incomplete pass. ANOTHER WHISTLE. COTTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shuck the blocker, Mike! Michael gingerly sets the lineman on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE STANDS
dialogues.text: Leigh Anne shows up, sits next to Sean. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's he doing? SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't quite have the hang of it yet.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: Michael tries to crawl under the blocker. (CONTINUED)     58

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 96 96 CONTINUED: COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Michael drops back and tries to intercept a pass. COTTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Michael holds a blocker off him with one arm and looks skyward as a flock of birds flies overhead. COTTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! No! No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As players leave the field, Bert Cotton walks and talks w Leigh Anne and Sean... COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most kids from bad situations can't wait to be violent and that comes out on the field. But this kid, he doesn't seem to wanna hit anyone. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost to herself) He's Ferdinand the Bull. COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought for sure he was gonna be a player. I can't believe I used up my chits to get him in school. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you said it was your Christian duty? He gives her a smirk. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Bert, he's never even played before. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 59 97 CONTINUED: 97 COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he won't in the fall if he doesn't improve a lot before then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Si, holding a sheet and wearing a whistle, stands before Michael. No one else'is around. SI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your summer workout sheet. First it says to warm up and get loose. (off Michael's look) Well, go ahead, get loose. Michael moves his arms around a bit then stops. SJ (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You loose? (MICHAEL NODS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, next is five one hundred yard runs to stretch out your legs. Michael grimaces. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go home, play some video games. SI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, everybody at. Wingate is expecting you to be a star football player. You don't want to let them down, do you? MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iono.. SI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Dad and Mom? (off Michael's look) 'Cause you see, in our family, everyone's an athlete. Dad was a basketball star, Collins plays volleyball and runs track. Me, as you know, I do it all and Mom,... well, Mom was a cheerleader, which doesn't exactly count but don't tell her I said that. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 60 98 CONTINUED: 98 MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... Michael moves to the line. Si raises his whistle and blow 99

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: SJ holds a blocking dummy and Michael fires out, hitting the dummy and sending Si flying. Michael does ten yard "back and forths" as Si times him. Michael does push ups as SJ lowers himself to count. Michael does crab crawls. WIDE - SJ runs Michael through his workout. He blows his whistle and Michael collapses on the ground - dead tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh Anne goes through sample boxes and matches swatches MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Tuohy? Michael stands nearby. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear "Mrs. Tuohy" I look over my shoulder for my mother--in-law. Call me Leigh Anne or Mama or almost anything else. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you help get me something? LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver's license. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you need a driver's license when you don't have a car? MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a car. (CONTINUED)     61

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 100 100 CONTINUED: LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That I use to haul y'all all over creation with. He doesn't say anything but doesn't leave either. Leigh A puts down the swatches, turns to him..

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why do you want a license, Michael? MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something to carry. With my name on it. She locks eyes with him. This time he holds her gaze.

dialogues.speaker: DMV EMPLOYEE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Address?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh Anne and Michael sit across from a DMV EMPLOYEE typ on her computer. Leigh Anne holds out her driver's licens DMV EMPLOYEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this his address as well? LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. He lives with us. DMV EMPLOYEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are y'all his foster parents? LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. DMV EMPLOYEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His legal guardians? LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: oh... no. The Employee does a search on the computer. As she types. DMV EMPLOYEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does he have a Social Security card? Leigh Anne looks to Michael, who shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: DMV EMPLOYEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Birth certificate? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 62 101 CONTINUED: 101 LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We tried to find one for school, but...

dialogues.speaker: DMV.EMPLOYEE
dialogues.text: You don't know which city, which county, which hospital?... LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How big a problem is this? DMV Employee looks to Leigh Anne. DMV EMPLOYEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nobody named Michael Oher in the system. Another last name perhaps? Leigh Anne again turns to Michael, who shrugs. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'll sign something saying he lives with us and we'll pay for the insurance; whatever it takes. (off her look) What's it gonna take? Off the Employee's look --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they get ready for bed. Sean rinses his mouth -- SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna do what?! LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't pretend you didn't hear me. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't we at least talk about it? LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think we're doing? And don't act like I'm going behind your back. I know you put us down as his medical contact at school. (CONTINUED)
102 CONTINUED: 102 SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a big difference between paying for a broken arm and being legally responsible for someone. Someone we barely know. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's another thing. We have to find out more about his past. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't talk about it. He's like an onion; you have to peel it a layer at a time. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if you use a knife. What if we sent him to a child psychologist? SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you really expect Big Mike -- LEIGH ANNE MICHAEL --- SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- expect Michael to lie down and talk about his childhood like he's Woody Allen or something? Michael's gift is his ability to forget. He's mad at no one and doesn't really care what happened in the past. This puts her on her heels. LEIGH'ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (like he's never heard THESE WORDS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me? "You're right?" (off her grimace) How'd those words taste coming out of your mouth? LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like vinegar. She moves to him, holds him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 64 102 CONTINUED: 102

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: At least promise me you'll think about it. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Alright" you'll think about it or "alright" we should do it? SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a difference?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh Anne sits in a crowded waiting area, talking on her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cell phone. She's been here awhile. LEIGH ANNE (INTO CELL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell Rodney to hold the chiffonier for me and I'll get by after while. TO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up and, exasperated by the wait, rises and walk a counter, pushing past someone --

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm not cutting, just asking. (TO EMPLOYEE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been waiting for over an hour and I look around and all I see is people shooting the bull and drinking coffee. Who runs this place anyway? The "heard it all" EMPLOYEE points to the wall with a government seal and a large portrait of President Bush.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well I'd have it in shape in two days, I can tell you that. EMPLOYEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure you would. How can I help you? She turns to the man waiting behind her. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was first. (CONTINUED)     65

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 103 103 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN LINE
dialogues.text: No, you go ahead. I think I. want to hear this. EMPLOYEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too. LEIGH ANNE (TO EMPLOYEE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not appreciate the attitude. EMPLOYEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma'am, you can tell me what you want or I'll make sure you wait all day. How. Can. I. Help. You? LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to become a legal guardian. EMPLOYEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lord look over that child. (LATER) 104

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A haggard MANAGER, let's call him RONALD, sits across fro Leigh Ann. He looks at a flimsy file. RONALD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's very little on Michael. Most of his files have been lost. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is in there? RONALD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few case notes. (holds one sheet up) This one describes an incident where officers forcibly removed Michael and six half-siblings from Denise Oher's care when Michael was seven. Quite a scene evidently. They had to split up the kids. And it's far from the worst. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she? His mother? RONALD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunno, but if you find her we have a bunch more files we could add to. (CONTINUED.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 66 104 CONTINUED: 104 LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many children does she have? RONALD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least a dozen, probably more. With her drug arrest record my guess would be she can't even remember. Leigh Anne absorbs this. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd need her permission though, .right? RONALD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Michael is a ward of the state. Just apply and get a Judge to sign off on it. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you would give him away without even telling his mother? Ronald shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks the same as before except for the'blonde woman walk between the buildings. Leigh Anne spots and checks a list of tenants posted. She can barely see through the cover as someone has scrawled Block" on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one Michael visited before. Leigh Anne summons her courage and knocks on the door. And again. No answer. A VOICE comes from the apartment behind her --

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Who you lookin' for?! Startled, Leigh Anne turns and sees Alton approaching... LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for Denise Oher. ALTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dee Dee don't stay there no more. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 67 106 CONTINUED: 106 LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know where she might be? ALTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chances are she ain't gone far. (SMILES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I seen you before. You with Big Mike now. You wanna come in for a wine cooler or sumthin'? LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I can't, but thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh Anne speaks with a mother trying to keep her son fr hurting himself on a rusty slide. The mother points to another building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door opens revealing DENISE OHER in a ratty robe. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Mrs. Oher? DENISE OHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You from the state? LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. My. name is Leigh Anne Tuohy and your son Michael lives with me. And my family. Denise takes this in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh Anne sits on the edge of a filthy couch and eyes.th room. There are sleeping pallets on the floor and empty w and beer bottles strewn around.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE OHER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: How is my boy, how's Big Mike? LEIGH ANNE (CALLS OUT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's fine. He's doing well. (after a beat) When did you move from the other building? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 68 109 CONTINUED: 109

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denise emerges from the back of the apartment, adjusting wig on her head, making herself "presentable." DENISE OHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awhile back. This is temporary. Friends let me stay here. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did you last see Michael? DENISE OHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iono. We might have some wine in the kitchen, if... LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no that's very kind but... DENISE OHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many foster kids you got living with you? LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm not a foster parent to Michael. We were just helping him out. DENISE OHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: State don't pay you nothing? LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. DENISE OHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he lives with you? (Leigh Anne nods) And you feed him?. (ANOTHER NOD)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buy him clothes, too? LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I can find them in his size. DENISE OHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You a fine Christian lady. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I try to be. DENISE OHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is all real nice what you're doing, but don't be surprised if one day you wake up and he gone. (CONTINUED)
109 109 CONTINUED: LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? DENISE OHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a "runner". That's what the state called him after they took him from me. (off her look) Every foster home they sent him to, he'd slip out the window at night and come looking for me. No matter where I was that boy would come find me, take care of me. (AN EXPLANATION)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had some . health problems. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Oher, was Michael born under a different name? Denise tries to remember. After a few seconds... DENISE OHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Proctor. That was his Daddy's last name. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he, the father, if you don't mind me asking? DENISE OHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't. seen him since he left. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when was that? DENISE OHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Week after Mike was born. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have Michael's birth certificate? Denise sighs, looks around at the mess, shakes her head. then, unexpectedly, starts to cry softly.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's okay, Mrs. Oher.. I'll figure it out. Leigh Anne walks over, kneels and takes Denise's hands. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 70 109 CONTINUED: 109

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You'll always be Michael's Mama. Would you like to see him? DENISE OHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... Not this way. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People lose birth certificates. It's nothing to be ashamed of. DENISE OHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Williams. (off Leigh Anne's look) His last name's Williams. Couldn't even remember who the boy's father is. Leigh Anne bites her lip'and puts her arms around Denise, hugs back. DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire Tuohy family sits with Michael at the table. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, we have something to ask you. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh. Anne and I would like to become your legal guardians. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that mean? LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what it means is, we want to know if you'd like to be a part of this family? Michael looks to a grinning SJ, to Collins who nods and smiles, then to Leigh Anne... MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kinda thought I already was. (CONTINUED)     71

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 110 110 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh Anne feels a wave of emotion, nods to him, then rac away to go and gather herself. - "I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael looks to Sean for an explanation. Sean shrugs can't explain her to you."

dialogues.speaker: A CAMERA FLASH, (IN DMV OFFICE)
dialogues.text: When it clears we see MICHAEL'S FACE - on a DRIVER'S LICE 112

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, blindfolded, is led outside by the entire family When Leigh Anne pulls if off, Michael gasps at the sight A NEW TRUCK in the driveway. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that the one you wanted? He just stands there, staring. Sean hands him the keys. SEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, hell, take it for a spin. (off Michael's look) Go on. SI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I go, too? LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: okay, but Michael?... (off his look) Be careful. Michael smiles and he and SJ get inside the truck. COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wanted a truck?! SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael thinks he's a redneck. 113

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael drives up in his new truck, parks it carefully. At the drop off Big Tony's car sputters away, leaving Ste at the curb. Steven notices Michael and walks over, eyein the truck. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 72 113 CONTINUED: 113 MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tenth grade tough? STEVEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw. (points to truck) This really yours? MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. STEVEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They just give it to ya'? MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. After a beat... STEVEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. white people are crazy. And they walk off together to class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Students seated, including Michael, listen to Bob, who st at the front of the classroom.  BOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are now seniors. Congratulations. But with that  distinction comes responsibility. This will be one of your tougher courses because my job is to prepare you, at least most of you, for the rigors of college Freshman English. You are each holding a  class study guide which details assignments. I won't remind you what is due and when. Read the materials and come prepared. At the end of the year you will each choose one of our literature assignments and present a written dissection of the piece. The faces in the classroom tell us this is a tough course

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dozens of.condiment jars and bottles are lined up on the table. SJ has the football playbook open and is explainin formations to Michael. SI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, you're the ketchup, here at Left Tackle. On the weakside. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not that weak, SJ. SI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: it just means there are more blockers on the other side. It's a compliment, really. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A compliment for a condiment. SJ (CHUCKLES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good one. (back to work) So the first play is simple. "Gap." It just means you block whoever is in front of you, or the person on your inside shoulder if you're not covered by a defender. (points to condiments) I'll be the running back and you show me what you're supposed to do. Ready... . Hike! SJ, using both hands, moves Cayenne pepper back a bit, th "hands off" to Cinnamon who "runs" toward Michael (Ketchu Michael moves the bottle forward, pushing back Mustard, t Relish, as well as toppling a bottle of Vanilla Extract. SJ (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open lane to the end zone. All there is to it. Si slides Cinnamon forward. The bottle flies off the end the table and crashes on the ground just as -- Leigh Anne walks down the stairs, purse in hand -- LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is going on here?! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 74 115 CONTINUED: 115 MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cinnamon just scored. SI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going through the playbook. Michael got moved to offense.. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, when you're finished, put the players back in the spice cabinet. SJ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem. Actually, Mom, we were waiting for you. The new Madden came out and me and Michael want to go get it. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, I've got a meeting in ten minutes. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll drive. off her look --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael drives while SJ searches for music on the radio. SI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look for Walker Street. That's where we take a left. Si finds a hip-hop station and they both groove to the be dancing in the seats.

dialogues.speaker: SJ
dialogues.text: That's what I'm talkin' 'bout! As the beat reaches a crescendo -- Michael instinctively throws a big arm in front of SJ as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE-truck CRASHES into the side of a VAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh Anne, with a client, is looking at rugs with the ow (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 75 118 118 CONTINUED: LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.text: As she approaches she sees -- Michael's truck -- the fron is smashed -- The Van - its side caved in -- And -- Michael sitting on the curb, crying. She races over -- LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.text: Michael! He looks up, sobbing. MICHAEL

dialogues.text: Go help him! Please go help him! Leigh Anne turns to see a group of PARAMEDICS kneeling ar a body. She gasps, races over and looks down at -- Si, whose face is bloody. He spots Leigh Anne and sits up SI

dialogues.text: 76 119 119 CONTINUED:

dialogues.text: While the paramedics attend to an obviously fine SJ, Leig Anne and a FIREMAN eye the deflated airbag.  FIREMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's okay, though, right?  FIREMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Busted lip, some facial bruising.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When an airbag strikes a child his size it usually means a fractured face, a broken neck or worse. It's almost like the airbag started at him then changed direction. Defective or something. Very, very lucky. Leigh Anne nods thanks and looks to Michael, still on the curb, eyes on the ground. She walks over, kneels down. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, it wasn't your fault. It could have happened to anybody.. He doesn't look up. She almost gasps when she notices -- HIS ARM - red, bleeding, a large burn from the wrist all way up to the sleeve, which is also singed.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Michael, your arm... what happened? He looks up and into her eyes... MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I stopped it. 120

dialogues.text: SJ sits in the stands videotaping -- [NOTE: We integrate video with live action]. ON THE FIELD: Michael skips to the line and gets down in stance. On the snap Michael pushes the tackle, JAY COLLIS who rolls, gets by Michael and makes the tackle. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: 77 120 CONTINUED: 120 COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 0her! You've got a hundred pounds on Collis and you can't keep him out of our backfield?!

dialogues.text: Leigh Anne sits down next to SJ. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's. with the camera? SI

dialogues.text: Michael does better when he can see what he's supposed to be doing.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE FIELD
dialogues.text: The quarterback drops back to pass. Michael backpedals. W the Defender tries. to go around him, Michael grabs him.w one big paw and throws him to the ground. A WHISTLE BLOWS COTTON

dialogues.text: Holding - left tackle! He gets right in Michael's face, grabs his jersey. COTTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can only grab in here -- at the tits, you got it?! You grab out here or here, we're gonna get flagged and I'm gonna get pissed. Leigh Anne grimaces, shakes her head. NEXT PLAY

dialogues.text: Move your feet, son! Keep 'em moving! Back to the huddle! Cotton addresses an ASSISTANT COACH... COTTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well at least he'll look good coming off the bus. The other team will be terrified 'til they realize he's a marshmallow. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: 78 120 120 CONTINUED:

dialogues.text: As they chuckle, Leigh Anne strides past, onto the field. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.text: Gimme a minute, Bert. COTTON

dialogues.text: You can thank me later. Bert just watches as Leigh Anne walks straight to the hud and pulls Michael aside. The other players turn to watch.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you remember just after we met, and we went to that horrible part of town to buy you those dreadful clothes? (HE NODS)

dialogues.text: And I was a little scared and you told me not to worry, that you had my back?. Do you remember that? MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes ma'am. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If anyone tried to get to me you would have stopped them, right? (HE NODS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when you and Si were in that car wreck, what did you do to that airbag? MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I stopped it. Leigh Anne points to the offense. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This team is your family. And you have to protect them -- (points to defense) --from those guys. She walks over and grabs the QB, pulls him out.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tony is your quarterback. You protect his blindside. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 79 120 120 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When you look at him, think of me. How you have my back. How you have his. She grabs BOBBY, a short stump of a running back.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: oomaloompah here is your tailback. When you look at him think of SJ and how you'd never let anything or anyone hurt him. Do you understand me? MICHAEL

dialogues.text: What about Mr. Tuohy and Collins? LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose they can be on the team, too. Are you going to protect the family, Michael?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods. She nods back and walks away, past Bert Cotton.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yelling at him won't help. He doesn't trust men. In his experience they pretend to care about you 'til they disappear. Cotton chuckles.. She walks over and sits next to SJ, who the video camera in his lap.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're gonna wanna get this.

dialogues.text: At the snap Michael drives the defender into the dirt. Michael drops back, knocks down one defender, then takes on another while Tony completes a pass. On a sweep to his side, Michael pushes three defenders away, clearing an alley for Bobby to blast through.

dialogues.text: You should get to know your

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: It's later, Bert! COTTON (BY ROTE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Leigh Anne. 121

dialogues.text: Packed'house - bands, banners, cheerleaders. IN THE STANDS: Sean, Leigh Anne and SJ take their seats a check out the raucous crowd. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Nascar, not even close. 122

dialogues.text: Coach Cotton is addressing his team before the game. COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the schedule it says this is a home game but don't be deceived, gentlemen. Three fourths of the people in the stands are here from Milford. They'll be loud and rowdy and a lot of 'em drunk. Keep your helmets on 'til you're on the sidelines. I don't want anyone getting beaned with a whiskey bottle. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grab a knee. And the team huddles for their prayer... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 81 122 122 CONTINUED: COTTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For we can... (team repeats each phrase) Do all things... Through Jesus Christ... Who strengthens us... Each and every day...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And may God... Bless the Crusaders! As they rise to leave-- COTTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, one more thing. The reason Milford traveled all that way to come here is they expect to whup your ass. Whup your ass and have a party in your house. Whup your ass, have a party in your house and piss on your mama's new couch. Is that gonna happen? The team erupts with a chorus of NO'.s and HELL NO!s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Wingate Crusaders exit the dressing room they find themselves next to the Milford Lions ready to take the fi The cocky Milford players eye the Crusaders. MILFORD PLAYER

dialogues.text: Would y'all look at the size of that buck!

dialogues.text: Milford takes the field. Jay Collis, to Michael...  JAY COLLIS

dialogues.text: Pay 'em back on the field. Coach Cotton raises a hand and the team moves forward to squeeze through an entrance onto the field. Above them Milford fans look down and jeer, toss sodas at them.

dialogues.text: The Blind Side -- Yellow Draft - 04/15/09 82

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILFORD DAD

dialogues.text: Damn, that ain't fair! They got a big ole' black bear playing for 'em! What is this, a circus?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Where it goes he goes. And block 'til the whistle blows. All right? Michael nods and takes a seat on the bench. Cotton hears something and realizes it is his cell phone. He looks at number calling. and answers... COTTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: Sticks and stones?

dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right. Settle down.

dialogues.text: The Crusaders have the ball at the twenty. They break fro the huddle, get over the ball and the play starts. It's a sweep left and Michael pulls to lead for Bobby. 66 fends Michael and keeps moving, forcing a pileup near the sidel Michael and Bobby are at the bottom of the pile. 66 extricates himself from the pile and gives Michael a little kick as a cherry on top. MILFORD #66

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big black pile of nigger crap! Cotton is nearby, hears this, races straight over to the COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ref, you gonna do something about this?! He kicked my boy in the head and cussed him! The Ref throws a flag. COTTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Unsportsmanlike conduct on Wingate! Fifteen yards. Shut up or you'll get another fifteen. COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to the first Amendment?! Cotton throws his hat and another ref throws a flag. COTTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This young man plays for my team and I will defend him like he's my own son! Against you or any other redneck sonofabitch! Michael watches, dumbfounded. He walks over to the livid Cotton and pulls him backwards, looks him in the eye. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: 86 124 CONTINUED: 124 MICHAEL

dialogues.text: Don't worry, Coach. I got your back. Cotton cools down. Michael trots out onto the field. Halfway there he stops, looks back at Cotton and smiles. REFEREE

The ploy right 66 but the damage isn't over as Michael now has him "in t fit" grabbing his jersey, "between the tits." -- Bobby races through the hole and into the secondary -- Michael keeps pushing 66 back, picking up speed until 66 airborne save every third step of Michael's when he touch toe to the ground like a ballerina -- Bobby cuts to the sideline -- Michael is running full speed with 66 now and he keeps go past the sideline-- Past Collins and the rest of the cheerleaders while -- Bobby makes the opposite corner and heads for the end zon (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: Si is on his feet, filming Michael -- Michael keeps going, past the track and toward the fence separating the field from the parking lot -- Just as Bobby races into the end zone -- Michael chucks 66 into the air. 66 hits the fence hard an lands in a heap. Michael turns and walks back to the fiel As he passes Collins she gives him a high five. COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way to go big bro! A referee signals touchdown then notices Michael walking and 66 lying slumped at the fence. The Ref throws a flag. COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what?! Was he holding? REFEREE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, no. COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he hit after the whistle? REFEREE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe so. COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what's the flag for? REFEREE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno... . Excessive blocking. COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding me. The Referee ignores and returns to the field to assess th penalty. 66, now on his feet, limps back onto the field. Michael looks at him and 66's eyes go straight to the dir Cotton walks up to Michael. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Coach. I stopped when I heard the whistle. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: 88 124 124 CONTINUED: COTTON

dialogues.text: Where were you taking him, Mike? MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the bus. It was time for him to go home. Cotton smiles proudly and slaps Michael on the ass. COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attaboy, Michael Oher. Attaboy!

dialogues.text: Leigh Anne stands and turns to face the Milford fans LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See number seventy-four? Well, that's MY son.! The Milford fans don't know what to make of this. Leigh A sits down with a self-satisfied smile.

AT THE SNAP the Scrub flinches and hits the dirt. The pla goes to the other side and Michael reaches a hand down to help the Scrub up and to his feet. 12 5

dialogues.text: A hub of activity. Move past a SECRETARY answering phones (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: 89 126 CONTINUED: 126 SECRETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom Lemming Recruiting, please hold... Tom Lemming Recruiting, please hold... And land on TOM LEMMING, the foremost college talent forecaster in the country. TOM LEMMING . Did the monthly recruiting updates get mailed? SECRETARY

dialogues.text: Does he really think getting it one day early is gonna give LSU a leg up? An ASSISTANT hurries up. ASSISTANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you filled all the slots for the Army All Star Game? TOM LEMMING

dialogues.text: Yeah, why? The assistant hands over the distinctive DVD marked MICHA

dialogues.speaker: OHER
dialogues.text: ASSISTANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might want to open one up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemming walks along with Sean and Coach Cotton toward Sea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: office. TOM LEMMING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every year there are a dozen running backs in the high school ranks who will make it to the NFL. Quarterbacks maybe three or four. But left tackles, true left tackles, they're freaks, gifts from the gods. A great one only comes around every four or five years. Mike's the best I've seen in ten. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 90 127 CONTINUED: 127 COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding? TOM LEMMING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't kid about guys who'll get fifty million or more to play football. COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you think that could be Michael? TOM LEMMING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. The embarrassing thing is it's my business to know every prospect in the nation but if you hadn't sent me that DVD I would have never heard of him. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What DVD? I didn't send a DVD. TOM LEMMING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Sean Tuohy, right? Sean "gets it", trades a look with Cotton. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Si.

dialogues.text: They arrive at an empty office where Michael sits. He sta and Lemming eyes him like a piece of meat... TOM LEMMING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Just wow. Lemming breaks out a measuring tape and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean and Bert stand outside and talk...  COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom Lemming runs the biggest recruiting service in the nation. He practically created an industry. Every college coach subscribes to his newsletter. One word from him and... This is big, Sean.

dialogues.text: Mike, I came all the way from Chicago just to see for myself. And now that I have, I'd like to extend to you an invitation to play in the Army High School All American game at the end of the season. He places an application on the desk. Michael stares at i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to offend but... does Mike have special needs? SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he eats a lot. TOM LEMMING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I meant, is he mentally... off? SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, he's just... COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shy. Really shy. TOM LEMMING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because the only thing he said to me was "No." Said it three times; every time I asked him if he'd like to play in the Army All Star game. I get lobbied by every player, every father, every coach to get into this game. (hands over application) Let me know if he changes his mind. Lemming walks away. After he's gone, Michael emerges. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you fill out the application, Michael? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: The Blind Side - Green Revision - 04/28/09 92 131 CONTINUED: 131 MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna join the Army. Sean and Coach Cotton crack up.
