dialogues.text: Leigh Anne helps coach the cheerleaders, including Collin LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kick higher, Collins. Point your toes! Leigh Anne notices Fulmer.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What in the world?... (to the squad) Y'all keep practicing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Blind Side - Green Revision - 04/28/09 93 138 CONTINUED: 138

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She strides toward the football practice field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh Anne arrives to see a group of coaches, all wearing shirts and hats emblazoned with school logos. They chat a watch as the Wingate football team finishes calisthenics. One ASSISTANT COACH, from. Southern Miss, sees Fulmer rac up.

dialogues.speaker: SOUTHERN MISS COACH
dialogues.text: Shoot, man, Fulmer's here. I might as well go home. Fulmer smiles at the assembled coaches, shakes a few-hand FULMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drove all the way from Knoxville to come see for myself. Leigh Anne slides in near the group so she can eavesdro

dialogues.speaker: CLEMSON ASSISTANT COACH
dialogues.text: Heck, I drove from Clemson, that's nine hours! Bert cotton walks over, shakes Fulmer's hand, leaving the other coaches shaking their heads. COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach Fulmer, it's a real honor. FULMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach Cotton I been keeping an eye on your program. Y'all doing a fine job down here. Wouldn't be a bit surprised to see you coaching at the next level real soon. Cotton's smile tells us he'd like that a lot.

dialogues.speaker: FULMER
dialogues.text: Is that him? Is that O'Hair? LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Oher. Like a paddle in a boat. Fulmer notices Leigh Anne, grunts then turns back to Cott (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 94 139 CONTINUED: 139 FULMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you could run him through a few drills, we'd sure appreciate it.. .Cotton gives Leigh Anne a look that says, "get out of he She shakes her head -- "I'm not going anywhere." Cotton blows his whistle and the team approaches. COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Board drill. Big Mike and Jay

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collis. Best on best. An Equipment manager lays out a plank and Jay Collis sigh and lines up, one foot on either side of the board. Micha slowly moves into position opposite him. The coaches all inch closer and crane their necks to see. Leigh Anne is now right in the middle of them. Fulmer giv her a look that says,,"Who the hell are you?" Cotton blows his whistle, Michael fires out and it's over

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: an instant. Collis is pancaked under Michael, who gets up and offers a hand. The coaches are frozen - as if they've witnessed a miracl FULMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost to himself) Force equals mass times acceleration. Then, all at once, the coaches pull out their cell phones start poking digits and jabbering: "You won't believe it! "You gotta see this!" "He's a freak of nature!" The Clemson coach strides away. COTTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going, Coach? CLEMSON COACH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to South Carolina. I've seen more than enough. If he can qualify with his grades you tell Michael Oher that Clemson wants him. FULMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck with that, Brad! Fulmer smiles wide then turns to look once more at Michae (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 95 139 CONTINUED: 139

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh Anne watches him watch Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh Anne, distressed, has books and pamphlets spread ou front of her. Sean walks in, takes in the sight. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know that to be eligible for a Division One scholarship Michael's gonna need a 2.5 GPA? SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His ACT is low and I don't see him doing any better if he retakes it. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's his GPA now? LEIGH ANNE
SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad really, when you consider where he started. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He needs to make A's this year. (off Sean's laugh) I'm serious. And that might not even be enough. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he goes to Junior College. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most inner city kids that go to JC drop out in a year. His shot at the pros would go out the window. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pros? Are we even sure he's gonna get college offers? She walks over to the answering machine, presses "Play." (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Blind Side - Green Revision - 04/28/09 96 140 CONTINUED: 140

dialogues.speaker: ON THE MACHINE
dialogues.text: Hello, my name is Nick Saban and I'm the head football coach at Louisiana State University... (Leigh Anne fast forwards) Tommy Tuberville, Auburn University... (fast forwards again) We're very interested in having Michael over to Knoxville for a visit. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil Fulmer, from Tennessee? LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are twenty more. She holds up a stack of mail - envelopes and Fed Exes.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And these. Fifty of 'em. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any from Ole Miss? LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They won't recruit until they hire a new coach. But none of it matters unless he makes his grades. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what do we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh Anne speaks to the assembled teachers. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So here's the plan. E-mail me all assignments and let me know what Michael has to do to make an "A". There is laughter in the room.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, fine, a B plus. And if anyone knows of a good tutor I'd love to hear about 'em.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BOSWELL
dialogues.text: I think I know someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Blind Side - Green Revision -- 04/28/09 97

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh Anne sits with MISS SUE, a no nonsense prospective tutor wearing an Ole Miss sweatshirt. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand that you applied for a teaching position at Wingate? MISS SUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't religious enough for 'em. I'm a spiritual person, Mrs. Tuohy, but I have certain,. shall we say... doubts. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate your honesty, Miss Sue. MISS SUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the situation with Michael? LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He needs to do better in school. MISS SUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obviously. But why the big push? LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in line for a football scholarship if he gets his grades up. MISS SUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he considering Ole Miss? LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'd better be. MISS SUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love to work with him. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When do you want to start? MISS SUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Tuohy there's something you should know about me. I don't tell many people, but it's something I feel you should be aware of before you hire me. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Blind Side - Green Revision - 04/28/09 98 142 CONTINUED: 142 LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? MISS SUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a Democrat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh Ann and Sean sneak looks at Miss Sue and Michael at dining room table.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE TABLE
dialogues.text: Michael stares at a problem in Geometry book, then... MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand it. MISS SUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yet. You don't understand it yet. How big is your head, Michael? MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big. MISS SUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what's in there? MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A brain. MISS SUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A brain. Full of knowledge - like a file cabinet with maps; shortcuts for figuring things out. You will learn this, Michael Oher because I'm here to help you use those maps and reach your destination. Like  Sacagawea helped Lewis and Clark.  MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sacagawea? MISS SUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get to that. And the history books have it wrong, but all you need to you know is that I'll get you there. Do you believe me? Do you trust me, Michael? MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Miss Sue. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Blind Side - Green Revision - 04/28/09 98A 143 CONTINUED: 143 MISS SUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try it again. He goes back to the book.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN AND LEIGH ANNE
dialogues.text: Sean shakes his head. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Blind Side - Green Revision - 04/28/09 99 143 CONTINUED: 143 SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who'd a thought we'd have a black son before we knew a Democrat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doorbell RINGS and Leigh Anne fixes her hair before s opens it to -- NICK SABAN, a handsome man wearing a sport jacket and LSU tie. Leigh Anne is immediately taken with him. NICK SABAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you must be Leigh Anne. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Coach Saban, that's me. Leigh Anne. Touhy. NICK SABAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, call me Nick. What an incredible home. Love the Windsor  valances. LEIGH ANNE (VERY IMPRESSED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. You obviously have good taste. NICK SABAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just say I appreciate quality. Michael and SJ walk in.

dialogues.speaker: NICK SABAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (EYEING MICHAEL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I know it when I see it. (offers a hand) Michael, I'm Nick Saban. And you must be SJ. I hear you have quite a jump shot, young man. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, why don't you and Michael go into the living room to talk. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can SJ come? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 100 146 CONTINUED: 146 SABAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. I'll recruit the both of you. As they walk away, Collins approaches... LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I find him extremely handsome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael and SJ sit across from Saban. SABAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, as soon as possible we'd like to get you down to Baton Rouge. We've got a great thing going, Michael and we plan on winning a bunch more National Championships. Whattaya' say, will you commit to a visit? Michael turns to SJ, who raises his hand. SI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ask a question? SABAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. SJ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My brother and me are very close. I'm worried that if he goes off to school I won't see him so... SABAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on. SI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I was just wondering how much access I'd have to him. Saban smiles at the kid's moxie. SABAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you what, SJ. Michael comes to LSU I'll get you an all-access pass. How's that sound? SJ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds good. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Blind Side - Green Revision - 04/28/09 101 147 CONTINUED: 147

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael pancakes an opponent --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael and Miss Sue study -- MISS SUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know this stuff. Just be logical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOUSTON NUTT walks in the Tuohy front door -- NUTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, I'm Houston Nutt from Arkansas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael pancakes another defender --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Sue high fives Michael after a quiz --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil Fulmer walks in, recognizes Leigh Anne FULMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a beautiful home, Ma'am. He is startled to see -- Michael, in briefs, racing down the stairs, carrying Coll who is holding his pants away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Boswell grades Michael's paper, writes "B" at the to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Blind Side - Green Revision - 04/28/09 102

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael and Coach Cotton hold up a championship trophy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coaches, one after another, enter the Tuohy home -- COACHES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, I'm Tommy Tuberville...Hi,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Lou Holtz...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SJ asks them each his question --- SI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What level of access can I expect?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coaches, one after another, up the ante ---- TOMMY TUBERVILLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your own locker right next to Michael's. HOUSTON NUTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Access to the Letterman's Lounge. LOU HOLTZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a wink) A Gamecock headdress. Real feathers. PHIL FULMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll run arm in arm onto the field and you can do the coin toss thingie at the first game. SI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds real good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael studies with Miss Sue, in her Ole Miss sweatshirt (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Blind Side - Yellow. Draft -- 04/15/09 103 161 CONTINUED: 161 MISS SUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you decided yet, Michael? MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Miss Sue. MISS SUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you like Tennessee? (off his nod) It's a good school. Not at the academic level of Ole Miss but they do have an outstanding science department. You know one of the things they're famous for? (he shakes his head) They work with the FBI to study the effects of the soil on decomposing body parts. Michael is a bit lost.

dialogues.speaker: MISS SUE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When they find a body the police want to know how long they've been dead. The fine department at Tennessee helps them. They have lots of body parts - arms, legs, hands - from hospitals and medical schools. Do you know where they store them? (Michael shakes his head) Right underneath the football field. Michael's eyes widen a bit.

dialogues.speaker: MISS SUE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So, while it's fine and dandy to have 100,000 fans cheering for you, the bodies you should be worried about are right underneath the turf. Set to poke up through the ground and grab you. She raises a clawed hand (think "CARRIE") to make her poi Michael is completely freaked out by this.

dialogues.speaker: MISS SUE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But it's your decision where you play football. Don't let me influence you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Blind Side Green Revision - 04/28/09 104

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ole Miss Coach, ED ORGERON, talks with Leigh Anne. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congrats on gettin' hired, Coach. ED ORGERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank yew, Ma'am. Ole Miss is my dream job. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach 0, you're coming a little late to the party but we're diehard Rebels so I'm gonna give you a frickin' road map, okay? ED ORGERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes 'm. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LSU is out. Everybody knows Saban's going to the NFL. So when he comes for his visit to Ole Miss, don't take him to some titty bar and give him tequila shots. He'll have nightmares for weeks. Feed him Italian - he likes Fettucine Alfredo - take him to a movie - but not Chainsaw massacre because he'll just cover his eyes - and put him to bed by ten. You got it? ED ORGERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes'm. What about Tennessee? LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It breaks my heart but they're still in the hunt. Fulmer offered SJ a sweet deal. ED ORGERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear the kid can really pepper the gumbo. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's his daddy's boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orgeron sits with Michael and SJ. ED ORGERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You a Ole Miss tackle, son. I'm buildin' my line, buildin' my team aroun' you. Make your parents proud, come to Oxford, get that sheepskin and help us win the SEC. Michael nods, turns to SJ. Before SJ can raise his hand -

dialogues.speaker: ED ORGERON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And for you, Si, here's what I can do. At Ole Miss we have The Grove by the stadium. And the team walks it before the game, surrounded by thousands of fans. It's a sacred ritual. And I'm in front. SI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ("that's it?") Seen it a thousand times. ED ORGERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever seen it from the front of the line? Next year, you and me -- leading the team. SI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tennessee offered to let me run on the field and flip the coin. ED ORGERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll throw in a sideline pass. Si considers this, smiles and nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A press conference is under way. Photographers push to ge shot of -- Michael, at a table, stares at three caps -- Tennessee, L and Ole Miss. He smiles and selects an Ole Miss hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fulmer watches the press conference on TV. He tosses a pi of chalk against the wall. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 106 165 CONTINUED: 165 FULMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This stinks to high heaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh Anne and Bob have a chat in the empty classroom. BOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will not give a student a grade he, or she, doesn't deserve. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He needs a B. What's he gonna have to do to "deserve" that? BOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now Michael's doing C minus, D plus work. His best chance at improving is with the written essay at the end of the year. It counts for a third of his grade. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it. We're sunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Sue works with Michael at the table. MISS SUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not write about "Great Expectations"? You're a lot like Pip. He was poor, an orphan and someone sort of found him. You should be able to relate to that. Michael shrugs. Sean is nearby, watching NBA basketball.

dialogues.speaker: MISS SUE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fine, let's go through the reading list. But you have to pick one, Michael. (reading from list) "Pygmalion"... "A Tale of Two Cities"... "The Charge of the Light Brigade"... SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost to himself) "Half a league, half a league, half a league onward." I love that one. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Blind Side - Yellow Draft --04/15/09 107 167 CONTINUED: 167 MISS SUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, you do this and I'll watch basketball. Miss Sue walks over, takes the remote from Sean, who rise SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "All in the valley of Death rode the six hundred". They call LSU's stadium Death Valley because of this story. Alfred, Lord Tennyson is writing about Ole Miss-LSU. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding? SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's a great story. MISS SUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a poem. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Forward the Light Brigade!" That's like the offense. "Charge for the guns'he said." That's the end zone. "Into the Valley of Death rode the six hundred." He knows it by heart and even miss Sue is impressed. SEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Forward the Light Brigade! Was there a man dГ‚В±smay'd? Not tho' the soldier knew someone had blundered." MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone made a mistake? SEAN'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, their leader, their coach. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would they go ahead if they knew he messed up? SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Theirs not to make reply, theirs not to reason why, theirs but to do and die: Into the Valley of Death rode the six hundred." (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 108 167 CONTINUED: 167

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It hits Michael. He takes a moment, looks right at Sean. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all gonna die, aren't they? SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's really, really sad. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you just found something to write about. Michael opens his notebook, picks up a pen.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Courage is a hard thing to figure. You can have courage based on a dumb idea or a mistake, but you're not supposed to question adults, or your coach, or your teacher because they make the rules. Maybe they know best but maybe they don't.

dialogues.speaker: DAY 168
dialogues.text: Michael moves through the tough crowd.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: It all depends on who you are, where you come from. Didn't at least one of the six hundred guys think about giving up and joining with the other side? I mean, Valley of Death, that's pretty salty stuff.

dialogues.speaker: DAY 169
dialogues.text: Michael walks under the arch for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: That's why courage is tricky. Should you always do what others tell you to do? Sometimes you might not even know why you're doing something. I mean, any fool can have courage.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT 170
dialogues.text: Michael leans against the wall and tries to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: But honor, that's the real reason you either do something or you don't. It's who you are and maybe who you want to be. If you die trying for something important then you have both honor and courage and that's pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob sits at his desk, reading Michael's. essay. As he tur to the last page...

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I think that's what the writer was saying. That you should try for courage and hope for honor. And maybe even pray that the people telling you what. to do have some, too. Bob, visibly moved, sets down the essay and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graduation day and Sean sits beside an empty seat in the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: quick filling auditorium. He sees Leigh Anne marching up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: aisle, a big smile on her face. she pushes down the row a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: plops down in the seat next to him. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? LEIGH ANNE
(off Sean's' look) Michael's final GPA. Got it off Paul's computer. He did it, Sean. He did it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean grins, then... SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. You broke into the principal's computer? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 110 172 CONTINUED: 172

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She ignores him and opens her program, letting Sean know is precisely what she did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graduation ceremonies. Paul Sandstrom reads the names and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the graduates move across the stage to get their diplomas

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As each student walks across the stage a BABY PICTURE of is PROJECTED.  SANDSTROM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael Jerome Oher. Even though no one is supposed to clap, a spontaneous rou of APPLAUSE gives Michael pause as he accepts his diploma

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Projected behind him is a picture of the cutest African-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: American infant the world has ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: ON SEAN AND LEIGH ANNE
dialogues.text: SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you find a baby picture of  Michael?  LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scanned it off an Internet ad for a toddler boutique. (off his look) Tell a soul and I'll rip your tongue out. IN THE CROWD: The Tuohys, Big Tony, Miss Sue, Bob and the other teachers all clap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, diploma in hand, shakes Sean's hand. Sean moves close, looks him in the eye.  SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to know something. You'n me, okay? (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never believed you could do this. But you did. And I'm as proud of you as I am ashamed of myself. I should know better. I'll never doubt you again, Michael. Michael smiles, nods, gives Leigh Anne a little hug then knuckles with Si and high fives Collins. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 111 174 CONTINUED: 174 LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me young man, but I think I need a proper hug. He smiles and moves to her. Off their embrace

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh Anne and Sean go over Ole Miss pamphlets with Micha LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be living in Deaton Hall -- here. You'll have a meal plan and you'll go to Johnson commons to eat. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnson Commons has all you can eat self-serve ice cream. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As much as you want? SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep, that's how Mama put on her freshman ten. Leigh Anne rolls up a pamphlet and whacks him hard on her to answer a RINGING PHONE. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello... This is Mrs. Tuohy... As she listens she gives Sean a look - "This isn't good". 184 INT. BUttDING HALLWAY - DAY 184 Leigh Anne walks with Michael.  LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They just want to ask you a few questions. You've got nothing to hide, Michael. They arrive at a door, open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sits Investigator Granger in the room we've seen before. rises, professional, but not smiling. GRANGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Tuohy? Mr. Oher? My name is Jocelyn Granger and I'm the Assistant Director of Enforcement for the NCAA. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please call me Leigh Anne. Leigh Anne shakes her hand and she and Michael move to th chairs. GRANGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Tuohy, I'd prefer to speak with Michael alone. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long will this take? GRANGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awhile. Michael starts rubbing his knees, nervous as hell. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, I'll be outside. Leigh Anne pecks his cheek and exits, giving Michael one look before she leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh Anne sits on a bench, talking on the phone. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a bad feeling about this, Sean. This broad is tough. Oh,. Susie's on the other line. (CLICKS OVER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... . what does the client want?... But that's tacky... You know what, fine, if she wants her living room to look like a bordello make it happen. She hangs up, checks her watch and looks toward the build

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The interrogation is ongoing... GRANGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your parents are friends with Coach Bert Cotton, correct? MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach is a good guy. GRANGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you aware that Coach Cotton is accepting a job at Ole Miss? (Michael shakes his head) And that this job offer came after you signed with them? (no response from Michael) Sean Tuohy, your legal guardian went to Ole Miss. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He played basketball. GRANGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Mrs. Tuohy attended Ole Miss as well. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was a cheerleader. GRANGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it safe to say that Ole Miss is their favorite school? (MICHAEL NODS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do they like any other Universities? (MICHAEL SHRUGS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about, say Tennessee? MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can't stand Tennessee. GRANGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So they wouldn't be happy if you chose to play football there? MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. GRANGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your tutor... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 114 187 CONTINUED: 187 MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Sue. GRANGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Sue is an Ole Miss grad, too. (MICHAEL NODS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did Miss Sue try to persuade you to attend Ole Miss? (MICHAEL NODS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know that the Tuohys make generous donations to Ole Miss? That even Miss Sue makes donations? That the:Tuohy's have a condo in Oxford so they can attend as many athletic events as possible? That, in fact, Sean and Leigh Anne Tuohy are by our definition "boosters." MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that mean? GRANGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A booster is someone with an abnormal interest in a school's sports. Someone who-contributes financially to the University's athletic program. Michael doesn't answer, just keeps rubbing his knees. The comes the part we've heard before...' GRANGER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Oher, do you know why I'm here? (NO RESPONSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Oher?...

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: GRANGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know, do you understand why I'm here?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: To... investigate. GRANGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. To investigate. I'm here to investigate your odd... predicament. Do you find it odd? Your predicament? (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 115 187 CONTINUED: 187 GRANGER (CONT'D) (NO RESPONSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael?... MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iono... she sifts through her briefcase, pulls out files, documen a good bit of evidence for whatever trouble Michael is in She sits back, stares at Michael, as if trying to figure out. Michael can't meet her gaze. He looks out the window rubs his knees some more. MICHAEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I... can I leave now? GRANGER (WITH FINALITY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You can't. Michael's building up anxiety by the second. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want, ma'am? GRANGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I want, what my job is, is to discern whether something untoward occurred in your recruitment to Ole Miss. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unto... GRANGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want the facts. I need the truth. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't lie... GRANGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I want to know what you think about all this. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: THINK ABOUT WHAT
dialogues.text: It's the first time we've ever heard Michael raise his vo It echoes in the room. Granger lets it die before she lea forward and continues... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 116 187 CONTINUED: 187 GRANGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NCAA fears that with your recruitment a door might be opened that boosters from lots of schools in the south will become legal guardians for young athletes without means and funnel them to their Alma Maters. Michael still doesn't get it, shakes his head. GRANGER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not saying I believe it and I'm not saying I don't, but there are many people involved with this case who would argue that the Tuohys took you in, fed you, clothed you, paid for your private education -- MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost to himself) No...no...no... GRANGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- bought you a car and paid for a tutor all as part of a plan to insure that you played football for the University of Mississippi. Now Michael understands. He stares at the floor for a lon time then quickly stands and makes for the door. GRANGER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, we're not finished. But he's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh Anne sees Michael exit the building. Once he's outs he moves in circles, gesticulating and talking to himself Leigh Anne races over -- LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, what's wrong? He looks at her, glares really; upset. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you do it? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 117 188 CONTINUED: 188 LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All along you wanted me to go to Ole Miss. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, of course, but... MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you do this for me?! LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything! Was it for you or was it for me? Was it so I would go to school where you wanted?! Was it so I would do what you wanted?! LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Michael... MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points to building) That's what she thinks! Is she right?! (her own words) Don't you dare lie to me! Leigh Anne digests this, takes a breath... LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, look... I can see where, where some people might... Her inability, for the first time, to articulate, hits Michael in the face. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not stupid! He turns and walks away. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael?! But she doesn't move, just watches him go. 189 OMITTED 189

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean and Leigh Anne sit at the kitchen table while Collin and SJ pace in the living room. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on her cell) Well if he comes by there let me know. Thanks. COLLINS (ON PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, please call me and let me know you're okay. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Text him SJ. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it light. Tell him you're gonna take his truck for a spin if he doesn't get in touch. SJ starts texting. Leigh Anne and Sean stare at each othe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (LATER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean sits in bed and Leigh Anne paces. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should have followed him. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had no way of knowing he'd disappear. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was he right? (off Sean's look) What he said about us? SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh Anne, be sensible. We gave clothes to a boy who had one pair of shorts. We gave him a bed. To hell with the NCAA, I'd do it again tomorrow. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: A191 CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the rest of it - all the stuff we did to make sure he got a scholarship? A scholarship to Ole Miss. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He could go wherever he wanted, he knew that. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he? Did you ask him? 'Cause I know for sure I never did. Sean considers this, then beckons. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here, honey. She moves to him. He puts his arm around her, kisses her forehead. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I a good person? (off his look) Not a joke. Not rhetorical. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the best person I know. Everything you do, you do for others. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is that? SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a smile) I have not a clue. You obviously get some sick satisfaction from it. She looks at him. There's truth in his words. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean... what if he never comes back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael makes his way toward Building "C", passing some o the same faces we've seen before. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 120 191 CONTINUED: 191

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alton opens his door to make a transaction with an addict spots Michael. ALTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That you Big Mike? Get your ass in here. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for Moms. ALTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Mama? Oh, I seen Dee Dee around. She usually stop by for a taste around this time. Tell you what, I'll get you a forty and we'll chop it up 'til she get here. Michael hesitates. Alton smiles, beckons. 192 OMITTED 192

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shitty but with good electronics. There are maybe eight people in the apartment - partying, drinking, getting hig Michael steps inside. Alton points to a chair. A stoned o couple smokes on the adjacent couch. Next to them an INFANT cries in a broken down crib. In th other corner of the room sits David, the young man we met before. Michael nods and David nods back. Alton hands Michael a beer. ALTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good to see you, Big Mike. You lookin' fit. I heard you playin' some ball. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. ALTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you know that rich kid football ain't like the public school league. People packing knives in their socks. Back in the day I was a quarterback. You knew that, right? At MLK. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 121 193 CONTINUED: 193 MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I heard. (TO DAVID)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still playing ball over at the

dialogues.speaker: JC
dialogues.text: DAVID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw. ALTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He with me now! I'll open a spot for you, too. DAVID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got tired of going to class. Always somebody tellin' me what to do. ALTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn it up, bitch! David jumps up and cranks the volume on a RAP SONG until beat is bouncing off the walls. Michael sips the beer; ru his knees. ALTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stayin' to the other side of town, that's what Dee Dee said. Said you got a new Mama. She fine, too. I seen her when she come to see Dee Dee. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She came here? ALTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She got any other kids? She got a daughter? (MICHAEL NODS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tap that? Michael sets down the beer, rises to leave. ALTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you going? Sit down. I wanna hear about your fine white sister. 'Cause I like me some mommy/daughter. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. Alton steps in front of Michael, raises his hands --- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 122 193 CONTINUED: 193 ALTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shutup?You tellin' me to shut up?I'llcap your fat ass. Cap yourass,drive east and pay a visittoyour Cracker Mama and her SWEETLITTLE --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael shoves him hard. Alton unprepared for the force, flies back against the wall. On the ground he reaches in belt for his gun, but just as he gets it out -- Michael slaps it away. He picks up Alton and throws him across the room. The party comes unhinged as Michael grab Alton, holds him against the wall with one hand while pounding him with the other. Blood flies from Alton's fac eighteen years of subdued rage coming out in seconds. TWO OTHER GUYS grab Michael from behind and one --

dialogues.speaker: STICKS A GUN IN MICHAEL'S TEMPLE
dialogues.text: Michael screams like a banshee, spins, grabs them and tac them over the couch. An errant round FIRES into the ceili A table flies and the crib smashes. Michael looks to David, frozen in the corner, then over t the SCREAMING child on the floor. He grabs his head and heaves, trying to make it all stop the music, the screams, the crying. The shots PULSE to th music and. are INTERCUT WITH:

dialogues.speaker: PULSING FLASHBACK IMAGES
dialogues.text: MICHAEL, AGE SEVEN, and several half brothers and sisters front of Hurt Village as Child Protective Services herds away from Denise Oher. She's screaming, the kids are cryi Michael breaks away and runs to Denise.

dialogues.speaker: MAMA
dialogues.text: He grabs her waist and is pulled away by an officer. FLASHBACK ENDS. BACK TO SCENE AT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Blind Side - Yellow Draft -- 04/15/09 123

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael looks at the blood on his hands and shirt and stumbles out of the room, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh Anne stands at the doorway to Michael's empty, very neat room. She stares, missing everything about him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh Anne drives around, looking for Michael at Wingate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The streets of west side of Memphis. And finally --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh Anne approaches the complex. Alton, his face bandag sits on the stoop with his crowd. A mother holds the unharmed baby. ALTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gone. Leigh Anne stops, looks to Alton. ALTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you tell him I'll be seeing him around. You tell him he'll get his. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael was here? ALTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last night. Sneaked me then took off like a little bitch. So you tell him, sleep with one eye open. Yod'hear me, bitch?' Leigh Anne steps closer to Alton, stares him down. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you hear me, bitch. You threaten my son you threaten me. You so much as cross downtown you'll be sorry. I'm in a prayer group with the D.A., I'm a member of the NRA and I am always packing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 124 199 CONTINUED: 199

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She taps her tiny purse. Alton laughs. ALTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you got in there, a .22? You got yourself a Saturday Night Special? LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it shoots just fine all the other days, too. She turns on her heels and strides to her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When she gets in she's so nervous she hyperventilates. He phone RINGS and she opens the tiny purse revealing nothin more than a wallet and the phone. She recognizes the numb and answers... LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael?!!! MICHAEL'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mama?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one where Michael spent the night. He sits inside.  Leigh Anne pulls up, stops and they lock eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: You think the police gonna come and get me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leigh Anne sits on the curb with Michael. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd imagine the last thing anybody at Hurt Village wants is cops snooping around. (after a beat) I swore I'd never ask but... how'd  you make it out of there, Michael?  MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was little and something awful was happening, my Mama would tell me to close my eyes. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
202 CONTINUED: 202 MICHAEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was tryin' to keep me from seeing her do drugs or other bad things. And she'd say, "keep 'em closed till I say so." And then when she was finished or the bad things were over she'd say, "now when I count to three, you open your eyes and the past is gone, the world is a good place, and it's all gonna be okay." LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You closed your eyes.  He nods. She shakes her head, amazed at the kid. They sta out at the street, then...

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know, when I was driving all over Kingdom Come looking for you I just kept thinking about one thing. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferdinand the bull. Everyone assumed because he was big that he wanted to fight in the ring. But he just wanted to sit under a tree and smell the flowers. (right at him) I know I should have asked this a long time ago but do you even wanna play football? I mean, do you even like it?' Michael considers this.  MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pretty good at it. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you are. (A BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean and I have been talking and Michael, if you're gonna accept a football scholarship we think it should be from Tennessee. (off his look) And I promise you I will be at every game cheering for you. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every game? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 126 202 CONTINUED: 202 LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I will not wear that gaudy orange of theirs because it's not in my color wheel. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to go to Tennessee? LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to go wherever you want. It's your decision, Michael. It's your life. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I wanted to flip burgers?  She takes this in, swallows hard and  LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your decision; your life. Michael smiles.  MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael is at another session with Jocelyn Granger.  MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I left the other day. GRANGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were pretty upset. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ask a lot of questions. GRANGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to get to the bottom of this. MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But all the questions you asked were about why everybody else wanted me to go to Ole Miss. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 127 203 CONTINUED: 203 GRANGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You asked about everybody but me. You never asked why I wanted to go there. GRANGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, fine, Michael... why do you want to go to Ole Miss? MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's where my family goes to school. It's where they've always gone to school. Granger considers this, stares at Michael, then almost, j almost, smiles. DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cars are unloaded as parents and siblings move their kids into the dorm. Tearful good-byes and lots of picture taki Leigh Anne and.Sean walk from the dorm toward the car, gi last words of advice. SJ and.Collins are there, too.  LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: College is going to be a different experience for you. There are lots of distractions. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just have fun. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There'll always be some nimrod in the dorm who wants to play video games all night, or goof off on the internet. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna have a great time. I know I did. Leigh Anne gives Sean a look - "You're not helping." (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 128 204 CONTINUED: 204 LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll spend lots of time at practice which means you have to be very dedicated to your studies.

dialogues.speaker: MISS SUE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Relax, Mama. Miss Sue walks up carrying papers.

dialogues.speaker: MISS SUE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just got back from the library where I reserved a private cubicle for the semester. (hands sheets to Michael) Here's your class schedule and our study hall hours. She reaches in her purse for her keys.

dialogues.speaker: MISS SUE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now, if y'all don't mind I'm gonna go move into my new apartment.  She walks away. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Miss Sue. MISS SUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah...  Sean and Michael and SJ eye a GROUP OF ATTRACTIVE COEDS  sashaying past. SJ does a little dance move and laughs. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a lot of fun. Leigh Anne notices their looks. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael Oher, you listen to me. I want you to enjoy yourself but you need to know that if you get a girl pregnant out of wedlock I will climb in the car, drive here to Oxford and cut off your penis. SI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto: to Michael) She means it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 129 204 CONTINUED: 204 MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes ma'am. Leigh Anne gives Sean a look that says, "let's get on the road." Sean offers a hand; Michael shakes it. Collins hig fives him. SJ offers a fist; Michael knocks it. Leigh Anne, tearing up, nods and gives Michael a quick hu MICHAEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Mama. Overwhelmed, she turns for the car with a little wave. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The 78'll be a parking lot. We should go. She gets inside and closes the door for privacy. Sean, SJ, Collins and Michael stand there, watching her c MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why does she always do that? SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's an onion, Michael. You have to peel her one layer at a time. Michael walks over to the car, knocks on the window. She rolls it down, dabbing tears from her eyes. LEIGH ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a proper hug. She gets out of the car and holds him for a long time. DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF STILL PHOTOS
dialogues.text: 205 NEWSPAPER HEADLINE 205

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE'S VOICE
dialogues.text: I read a story the other day about a boy from the projects. No daddy, in and out of foster care. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 130 205 CONTINUED: 205

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE'S VOICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He'd been killed in a gang fight at Hurt Village. 206 NEWSPAPER PHOTO 206

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A newspaper photo of a dead boy from the.projects. Then another headline, another young, black face. Another and another, until the last headline shows a photo of David, Alton's minion - his face full of shining promise.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE'S VOICE
dialogues.text: In the last paragraph they talked about his superb athletic skills and how different his life might have been if he hadn't fallen behind and dropped out of school. He was twenty-one years old the day he died. It was his birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lonely, falling apart.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE'S VOICE
dialogues.text: That could have been anyone. It could have been my son, Michael.

dialogues.speaker: STILL PHOTO OF OLE MISS CAMPUS
Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful on a fall day. And then THE STILL COMES TO LIFE and Michael, books in hand, ENTERS FRAME walking. It's li the other Michael/crowd shots with one difference - this he moves at the same speed as everyone else.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE'S VOICE
dialogues.text: But it wasn't. And I suppose I have God to thank for that. God and Lawrence Taylor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the family drives home from Ole Miss, we notice that L Anne is very still. And very content. She closes her eyes FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: LEIGH ANNE'S VOICE
dialogues.text: One Mississippi...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 131 209 SUPERSCRIPT: 209

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael Oher was a freshman All-American in his first sea and, with help from Miss Sue, made the Dean's List. Collins followed in her Mom's footsteps and became a cheerleader at Ole Miss. Sean and Leigh Anne still live in Memphis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Game day and Coach 0 and SJ walk together, leading the te to the stadium. 211
